I started playing this game on Sep 11, in that time I've racked up 225 hours of game play (as of this post). I honestly don't know why I had never heard of this game until this year. This is a sleeper and has so many things to offer:

Immersive story
Intense Gameplay
Relaxing Gameplay
Base building
Character design
Rogue Lite
Rogue Like
Not Rogue anything
Space Robot Ninja Wizards with Lazer Shotguns and  Quirky Sidekicks
Puzzle Games
Anti Puzzle Games

The list goes on and on. 

Moreover the community is VERY good at not giving out spoilers so you can ingest the game like it was brand new (or not, I'm not telling you how to play). There are many surprises and plenty of "WTF is going on here?!" moments that seemingly all get answered over time.

Finally, I'd like to say, you have NOT missed the boat on this one. There isn't a boat, it's a ferry going back and forth, and no matter when you start it's still the right time to start. That is, people who started when the game first came out aren't high-n-mighty  about being the first, but are happy to see new players join their ever growing community.  This game is my personal Game of the Year, even if I can't nominate it as such.

Once a darling of the free to play genre, Warframe has dissappointingly gone the way of so many others and become a mostly corrupt mess. It plays a lot like a mobile game now with timers and gates on everything, constantly demanding your microtransactions to avoid hours and hours of farming, which they also made impossible to do afk. Nerf by nerf, little by little, a once fairly enjoyable experience where you could unlock everything on Cetus in a week or so has become months of grinding Fortuna rep with a faction you dont like so you can get the Xaku warframe from Deimos. But hey thats okay you can avoid that just get out the wallet and pay to make the problem go away.

I played Warframe for years and I've always tried to get people into it, but more and more as time progresses I have to add caveats. You can play a huge open exploration map... unfortuantely half the mining nodes are bugged or placed on the roof where you cant get them. You can play as nearly 100 characters. It takes 8 hours of farming each one but hey you can kinda technically do that thing eventually in three years of playing 8 hours daily. All of the original frames will get nerfed and youll have to unlock new variants like Excalibur Umbra to do anything, following endless story missions that are disperate from one another and dont feel like they contribute to a central story. One second youre killing Vay Hek and the next second hes been dead for 3 years and his zombie is back. The pacing has become an absolute nightmare. There is feature bloat on top of the existing feature bloat and its very easy to break the flow and sequence of the story and be left in narrative limbo wondering what the heck is going on, whos working for who, and why I should even care when nothing has any consequences because you're just space jesus anyway. I've played a lot of the new content (unlocked Nokko, sorta fun, functionally useless compared to similar frames that work a lot less for the same result, but being immortal is cool) and done the Call of the Tempestrati, which was an absolutely abysmal experience about an edgelord, a hamfisted variant of phoenix from valorant, token asian female, token dominatrix female and a 90s tech nerd. Its gonna be tough hacking through all of that trash and dealing with those characters who have been done to death so many times I dont remember a single one of their names. Phoenix is called something like "Clancy" and has a sissy white guy name but thats literally all I remember about these characters im apparently supposed to like according to the story. They are utterly forgettable. The samurai guy has a scar over his eye. The british gangster guy unironically says "SKKKRAAAA" like youre in a battle with Big Shaq. They all call your character "Marty" which is a really funny reference to that joke they did two hours ago where one of the characters called you "Marty McFlea" because of your time travelling.

In a genre that thrives on "Show, don't tell" this games narrative is presented as "Tell and tell and tell and tell and tell and show 1 second of the problem, then tell and tell and tell and tell...". I put around 1700 hours into Warframe. I grinded everything, pushed through every wall, aimed for endgame, and genuinely loved it. Then suddenly — boom — I’m permanently banned for a chat argument from months ago. Someone provoked me, insulted me, kept poking at me, and I finally reacted. One moment, one sentence — and apparently 1700 hours don’t matter. For some people that’s literally years of grind wiped out instantly.

Here’s the part people really need to understand — because I didn’t, until it was too late:
You don’t need to be insulting someone.
You don’t need to mean anything malicious.
You can literally be joking with your own friends.
You can say something that wasn’t intended to offend anyone at all.
And guess what?
A single moment, a single slip-up, one stupid sentence in clan chat or squad chat — and months later it can still come back and obliterate your entire account. No warning, no “hey, don’t say that,” no nothing. Just instant permanent deletion.
They don’t hand out mutes.
They don’t hand out temporary timeouts.
They go straight for “remove this player from existence.”

After my ban, I started digging into it — and it turns out this nonsense is everywhere. People get banned for harmless jokes, friendly sarcasm, or something taken completely out of context. Even long-term players with perfect histories get wiped instantly. The system doesn’t care what you meant or who you were talking to — it just swings the hammer without thinking.

And here’s the part that really makes you laugh (or rage):
Loyalty means absolutely NOTHING.
1700 hours? Doesn’t matter.
3000 hours? Doesn’t matter.
5000 hours? Still doesn’t matter.
You can be the most dedicated, helpful, legitimate player ever — if you type one wrong word once, even if it wasn’t serious, even if it was friendly banter, even if you were DEFENDING yourself, the system will nuke your account without hesitation. Being loyal? Forget it.

Reaching out to support?
Prepare yourself.
You’ll get the most robotic, emotionless replies imaginable. It’s like they have a menu of preset responses and pick one at random. There’s no real conversation, no context, no attempt to understand anything. You might as well send your ticket to a refrigerator — at least it won’t pretend it cares while giving you copy-paste nonsense.

Let’s be clear: rules are fine. But going straight to PERMANENT deletion over a dumb moment, a sarcastic joke, or a heated argument is ridiculous. It’s like handing someone a life sentence for arguing in a supermarket. Humans joke. Humans argue. Humans get annoyed. Humans make mistakes. But in Warframe? You’re expected to be a flawless, emotionless robot 24/7.

And the most ridiculous part?
Chat is basically the backbone of the entire game.
Trading, recruiting, clans, squads, help channels — without chat, Warframe would collapse. The game relies on communication. Yet the same system that keeps the community alive is also the fastest way to lose your entire account. Want to enjoy the game? Stay away from chat. But without chat… what exactly are you left with?
The irony is painful.

Honestly, once the shock faded, I almost felt relieved. Because the truth? The grind is brutal. I genuinely have no idea how new players survive without spending money. Free-to-play players? Prepare for thousands of hours of grinding. I spent some money — not even much — and even then I barely touched endgame. Without paying, I’d probably still be stuck in the early star chart.

So here’s the final warning:
Warframe is an incredible game — one of the best gameplay experiences out there.
But the chat system?
It’s a landmine waiting for you to step on it.
Step on it once — even by accident, even joking with friends — and your entire account evaporates.

If you choose to play:
Enjoy the gameplay.
Enjoy the combat.
Enjoy the world.
But be careful — because ONE single word can cost you everything you ever earned.

Вы играете за студента кулинарного техникума, который должен выбрать свой путь, а именно – стать партнером легендарного Полковника Сандерса. Сами свидания с Полковником – это отдельная история, полная неловких моментов, кулинарных вызовов и неожиданных поворотов. Механика проста: выбирай ответы, развивай навыки и старайся понравиться Полковнику. Игра не претендует на глубину, но дарит массу смеха и позитивных эмоций. I Love You, Colonel Sanders! A Finger Lickin’ Good Dating Simulator is not a game, it's an e-book that's been dumped on Steam masquerading as a game.  As a visual/interactive novel, this doesn't feature any notable gameplay, it's just a lot of clicking through badly written dialogue that would never have been accepted or published in print, which poses the question, "How did something this badly written end up on Steam?".  When someone hoping to become an author is unable to get published in print, they spend $100 and dump their high school fan-fiction onto Steam, under the guise of a game.

I was wondering when this rather infamous marketing campaign from KFC would hit my queue.  And here it is.  It's not a game, first and foremost, it's a CYOA dating sim featuring Col. Harlan Sanders, the bane of all chickens.   This E-book was fronted on Steam by KFC's marketing department, and unsurprisingly went slightly viral.  So this is a parody of other e-books and the purpose is to sell fried chicken.   E-books aren't games, and this fast food advertisement also isn't a game.  Even the Noid game from Dominos had gameplay.  And, ultimately, this needs to be judged by the value it provides to PC gamers here on Steam, and that is none.

While this fast food advertisement E-book is "free",  Your gaming rig is not a Kindle, and we deserve better than having Steam be used as a tool of the marketing arms of global corporations.  It's impossible for me to recommend things to PC gamers that aren't really games.

This visual novel is the perfect example of why I don't like reading visual novels "for the meme." I'm all for comedy-heavy visual novels, but this KFC game feels like a big franchise owned by boomers trying to cater to lazy, lame Zoomer "meme" humor. And well, it's not great.

Once you get over the "lol, the characters are attracted to Colonel Sanders" gimmick, there's literally nothing memorable about it. The characters are just one-trick pony gimmick jokes that aren't funny, lack charm, and have super forgettable personalities.

The only positives I can give are that it's free and takes less than two hours to read in full. So at least if you don't like it, you didn't lose anything monetarily.

This isn't the worst or most unfunny visual novel I've ever read; I'll still take this humor over the cringe-fest of Alcot, ChuableSoft, favorite, feng, and some parts of Yuzusoft titles. However, this does NOT make it an actual funny game by any means. It has a lame "tryhard" comedy style that I don't recommend to anyone except those with godawful taste in Gen Z-style memes.

TERRIBLE GAME
     I started my playthrough with high hopes, expecting a whirlwind romantic adventure with the one and only Colonel Sanders. Visions of candlelit dinners, moonlit strolls, and tender moments shared over perfectly fried chicken danced through my head. My heart fluttered at the thought of winning his affections, picturing a happy ending where the two of us would ride off into the sunset, hand in hand, with a bucket of his famous chicken in the backseat. But as I dove deeper into the game, reality hit harder than a deep-fried drumstick.

     Instead of a heartwarming love story, I found myself embroiled in a bizarre, frustrating mess. Every interaction with Mr. Sanders was more confusing than the last, with no clear path to romance in sight. My dreams of sharing sweet nothings with the Colonel were dashed, replaced by cryptic conversations, meaningless tasks, and an utter lack of emotional connection. The game teased me with glimpses of what could have been, only to snatch it away at the last second, leaving me with nothing but disappointment and a sour taste in my mouth.

     By the time I reached the end, I realized that the happy ending I so desperately sought was never going to happen. No tender goodbyes, no romantic confessions—just an empty, unsatisfying conclusion that left me questioning why I even bothered. DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME; it's a complete waste of time. If you're looking for love, you'd be better off swiping right on a dating app than wasting hours on this pointless journey.

Jugué la primera entrega de Insurgency y me encantó por completo. Sus modos de juego, el ritmo, ese equilibrio entre arcade y realismo me parecieron una experiencia única dentro de los shooters en primera persona. Insurgency: Sandstorm mantiene ese mismo espíritu, pero elevando todo a otro nivel. Gráficamente es muy superior, el sonido es espectacular cada disparo, cada explosión se sienten intensamente reales y la jugabilidad sigue siendo su punto más fuerte.Este no es un shooter para cualquiera. Tiene un enfoque más táctico y realista que Call of Duty, pero no llega a los extremos de simulación de Arma, quedando justo en ese punto medio que lo hace tan especial. Su gunplay es excelente, el arsenal está muy bien trabajado, y los mapas y modos están diseñados para ofrecer combates intensos, inmersivos y llenos de tensión. Si encajas con este estilo de juego, es muy probable que te quedes por decenas o incluso cientos de horas. Y aunque no seas ese jugador “ideal”, Sandstorm sigue ofreciendo razones de sobra para jugarlo, sobre todo si tienes amigos con quienes compartir la **** definitiva, lo recomiendo sin dudar por su jugabilidad, por el realismo bien medido, por sus gráficos mejorados y por su sonido impresionante. Un multijugador diferente que merece más atención de la que tiene.

Just like my favorite game of all time L4D2 this game is extremely replayable the community might be toxic to certain people Yes i can see that but I LOVE them I interact with some of the same people here and there and they give me a good laugh. The game gets updates pretty frequently for things like cosmetics, maps, double xp (for account level) it doesn't let the game hang out to dry like what Rockstar games did to Red Dead Redemption 2 MP. The reason i put it as a 9/10 instead of a 10/10 is phasing issues when i shoot someone sometimes the bullet goes through them and hits behind them and there's a weird bug recently I've recently got in the pass few days of ground texture being black but it stops when the game is done, none the less if i had 30 bucks and trying to get an fps that will last me a long time, if im looking for a game that isn't COD, Rainbow 6, and im not looking for a game like ready or not/arma/squad, THIS IS THE GAME!!!

Insurgency: Sandstorm,stands out in the crowded field of first-person shooters with its intense and realistic depiction of modern combat. Launched as the sequel to the original Insurgency, Sandstorm enhances the franchise’s reputation for delivering gritty, tactical gameplay that rewards teamwork and strategy over lone-wolf **** of the most notable aspects of Insurgency: Sandstorm is its commitment to realism. The game eschews the more arcade-like elements found in many of its peers in favor of a more grounded approach. Weapons behave realistically, with significant recoil and authentic ballistics. This makes gunfights tense and deadly, where a single bullet can be fatal. The sound design further amplifies the immersion, with gunfire and explosions resonating with a visceral, bone-rattling intensity that places players right in the heart of the **** tactical gameplay is another strong point. Insurgency: Sandstorm requires players to communicate and coordinate effectively to succeed. Each match demands careful planning and precise execution, whether you’re capturing objectives, defending positions, or escorting valuable assets. The game’s various modes, including Push, Firefight, and Checkpoint, offer diverse challenges that test different aspects of tactical proficiency.Visually, Insurgency: Sandstorm may not boast the cutting-edge graphics of some AAA titles, but it compensates with meticulously designed maps that offer a variety of environments, from dense urban centers to sprawling rural landscapes. These maps are not only visually distinct but also intricately designed to support a wide range of tactical approaches.However, Insurgency: Sandstorm is not without its flaws. New players may find the steep learning curve daunting, as the game does little to hold your hand. The realism that hardcore fans love can be a barrier to entry for those accustomed to more forgiving shooters. Additionally, while the game has seen numerous updates and content additions, it still suffers from occasional bugs and performance issues that can detract from the overall experience.Despite these drawbacks, Insurgency: Sandstorm offers a refreshing alternative to more mainstream shooters. Its emphasis on realism and tactical gameplay creates a uniquely intense experience that stands out in the genre. For players who crave a challenging and authentic depiction of modern combat, Insurgency: Sandstorm is a compelling choice that rewards patience, precision, and teamwork.

Not able to review this for PS4 so I will drag the PC score down until I can: this game has been out 3 years on PC, it’s become quite apparent that PC footage was used to sell the PS4 version as the PS4 Day one version in no way looks like or has the fidelity of the PC version. It’s a stuttering, Tearing un optimized mess on day one, a new developer I would give a by ball but this is a 3 year old game and it looks and runs like a PS2 game with the graphics of MGS 1. Lets run down the list of issues this scummy developer thought they would get away with: No Hit Detector, No Kill Detector, A weird marker for friendly’s that appears to the side of them and at some distance from them, a broken comms system where enemy conversations can be heard, screen tearing, lack of any anti-aliasing, Lack of HD graphics, this things running in standard def, lack of textures, broken load out system that fails to remember saved load outs, Lack of progress markers, lack of round information, lack of scoring system, an extremely low draw distance, a gutted game mode system, no vehicles, pop in everywhere, lack of 60fps (in an FPS of all things) a mess of a menu system, a diabolical weapon modification system that remembers nothing, a class system that’s all over the place with standard sniper, heavy, light and assault classes all behind paywalls. And the most important part the bullet physics, I understand the game is built around this but with the exceptionally low graphics there is simply no point to it, I cannot see the drop to correct the shot through the tearing and jaggy choppy gameplay. A f*cking disgrace of a day one release after 3 years to polish. Its no wonder medicritic has reviews switched off on the PS4 and Xbox versions. Well let’s hope users who can’t review it over there come here and drag the PC score down with this sinking ship cause these scum don’t deserve to get away with this at £59.99… (DO NOT BUY ON CONSOLE! UTTERLY BROKEN)

What started as one of the most fun experiences of the modern gaming generation was stunted by a former dev team that doubled down on their questionable decisions. Now heralded by a dev  team that appears to prioritize enjoyment and game feel, the game is back to what it was at the start. Mindless fun that you could log into for a couple of hours and enjoy with friends. The movement sometimes clunky, the bugs infuriating, and the friendly fire always hilarious. If you're a fan of action multiplayer games that are PVE(or PVP depending on how your allies are feeling), then this game is one you shouldn't miss.

Helldivers 2 is a masterpiece in the action and cooperative shooter genre, bringing the gaming experience to a new generation with its stunning blend of strategy, teamwork, and adrenaline. The community is active, and there are always teammates ready to fight by your side. Moreover, the extensive character customisation and progression options provide excellent motivation to keep playing and improving. In short, it's a cracking game—the kind that only comes around every 15 or 20 years.

One of the greatest games in the roguelike genre. On par with such giants as Hades, TBoI and Dead Cells. The music is excellent and suits the game very well, the visuals are pleasant and understandable, the plot is a bit weak, but not bad at all, the replayability is cosmic, and the variety is huge. An amazing game. I understand those people who have more than 500 hours, 1k hours and more in it. The game is 5 years old since its release, and I still enjoy coming back to it. The community of this game has not disappointed either. They make funny memes and excellent mods with guides. What more could you want from dedicated fans? In co-op, the game reveals its full potential.

Très bon jeu, avec un système de difficulté augmentant avec le temps, et non le niveau dans lequel vous êtes. On voit au fur et a mesure de la partie son build devenir de plus en plus fort, avec une multitude de synergies disponibles, ce qui est très plaisant. 
Les differents personnages disponibles offrent tous un gameplay different, chacun ayant sa facon de tirer, ses propres capacités, assurant une très bonne rejouabilité.
J'ai joué la majorité du temps en multijoueur, et c'est une superbe expérience, parfois hilarante quand votre ami oblitère tout sur son passage.
Si vous aimez les roguelikes, il est impératif de jouer a ce jeu.
of any rougelike, this one does it the best, with every run being a unique experience and every other aspect being perfected as well

I was never too impressed with the game's presentation. I think i just needed more time to get comfortable with the game's general direction. It's not the most visually interesting game I've played, but at least the character design, enemy designs, level design, and colour grading all comes together to deliver a solid package of a visual style. I want to emphasis on the enemy designs here. Their designs are what sold me to the game's visual direction. The larger creatures has a certain aesthetic to them that compliments the background setting a lot.

I was also mixed on the music for a good while. I don't dislike them or anything, but i think i got very overwhelmed by the game's stimuli. The default settings for this game's audio was really loud and it made me uncomfortable. It's not until i turned down the volume until i could appreciate the game's audio design. The soundtrack elevates the hectic and chaotic battle sequences at least 10 times. Of course, this is only possible if the sound effects were good in the first place, and they are! the sound designs has so much weight to it. It really sells you the scale of the larger enemies in the game. Sound clues are also very effective here. A lot of sounds are exclusive to a certain type of threat. So a headphone/earphone is recommended to get the full experience.

This game's mechanics is the spotlight here. Risk of Rain 2 is a 3D Third person shooter game, and it uses that concept until the point of exhaustion. It's a philosophy that's very integral for any type of Art. You thought of a concept? use it over and over again until you couldn't think of anything more. Some of the most memorable enemies for me are the airborn ones! That's a serious feat in my opinion. And some of the on-ground enemies could jump/float! just to mess with your sense of vision. This game's battle sequences are extremely hectic and chaotic. This experience is probably what made me uncomfortable about the game for a good while. So many things could happen in a blink of an eye! the stimuli is insane.

Another thing about RoR 2's mechanics I've seen being brought up by the community is the Rogue-like implementation. Other Rogue-like video games won't allow you to have too many abilities in a single run, just because they don't want you to be too powerful. Like Hades, Inscryption, and Buckshot Roulette, just to name a few. Risk of Rain 2 is perfectly fine with you stacking up so many insane power ups on top of the external helps (Drones, Turrets, Guardians etc.). RoR 2 allows the player to feel like an absolute monster. How did the game balance this mechanic? The final boss could steal your items and abilities. You get them back by dealing damage at the bastard. Insane video game. The game's battle system oozes so much polish and care behind it. I couldn't help but feel inclined to boot up RoR 2 day after day just to experience it again. Risk of Rain 2 is a very fresh experience in the Rogue-like space. Not necessarily the absolute king of the genre, but a unique exprience nonetheless.

This recent playthrough made me see Risk of Rain 2 in a whole new light. A very complex and nuanced 10/10.I'll keep playing this game over and over again until i defeat that bastard Mithrix...

Inicialmente, Risk of Rain 2 me gustó mucho, pero a medida que fueron pasando las horas rápidamente se fue transformando cada vez más en aburrimiento. Las razones hablaré de ellas ahora, pero quiero que quede claro que lo jugué en solitario, con lo que probablemente las sensaciones y eso para quienes lo jueguen en multiplayer con amigos (como está diseñado) sean mejores. Si resumimos mucho, el juego es un shooter rogue-like, con mogollón de enemigos, cada vez más y más duros, en lo que explorar zonas para conseguir mejoras aleatorias y desbloquear el teleportador previa batalla contra el boss. El problema es que se hace muy repetitivo porque le faltan cosas típicas de los roguelike. Una de esas cosas es que los mapas aquí son fijos (con variaciones menores como zonas pequeñas que pueden estar accesibles o no), con lo cual se acaba conociendo los mismos demasiado, si además tenemos en cuenta que los primeros los ves todo el rato, se acaba haciendo muy repetitivo. Luego le falta una historia así como un sistema de progresión de cualquier clase que otorgue objetivos o razones para jugar, pero en este caso cada intento es completamente independiente. El único cambio que queda de una partida a otra es lo que vas desbloqueando, que se hace en base a conseguir logros, algunos de los cuales ocurrirán simplemente por ir jugando, pero la mayoría acaban dependiendo del azar de que te caigan los bonos adecuados, de que una habilidad ocurra de cierto modo, etc. lo cual acaba siendo muy frustrante. Igual que lo es el hecho de que, llegado cierto punto y con una build decente, al final el juego se resume en "te vas cargando todo sin que te hagan nada hasta que llegas al lugar equivocado y sin que puedas evitarlo, de una hostia te bajan entero". Gráficamente el juego tiene una estética muy suya pero personalmente no me ha gustado nada,  y tiene además ciertos problemas de legibilidad en la distancia (como que los cadáveres de ciertos enemigos parecen cofres). La música ahí ya es cosa de gustos, para mi es demasiado electrónica noventera, que es un género que no me convence, pero ahí habrá a quien si le parezca perfecta y sin duda, no puedo decir que sea mala pese a que no encaje en mis gustos. No hay voces como tales, los efectos de sonido son muy básicos. Y el juego tiene ciertos bugs ocasionales como cosas que spawnean dentro de paredes, una baja IA de enemigos y aliados, **** todo ello, Risk of Rain no me parece un juego terrible, pero tampoco gran cosa. Y acaba repitiéndose como una cena que te sienta pesada. Un 4.
This game takes too long to be developed, too little new features and nothing has really changed for years.

Pros: Intense atmosphere - Realistic gunplay - Teamwork is crucialCons: Steep learning curve - Outdated visuals - Not newbie-friendly Rising Storm 2: Vietnam stands out among war games with its emphasis on realism and tactical depth. It’s not the most accessible title, but once mastered, it offers a deeply satisfying and immersive experience. The game captures the chaos of the Vietnam War with great authenticity—from the crack of gunfire to the intensity of large-scale firefights. Teamwork is absolutely crucial, as success depends more on coordination than individual skill. While its dated visuals and steep difficulty may deter newcomers, players who enjoy a strategic and 
realistic FPS will find RS2 Vietnam to be a uniquely rewarding experience.

This game is really fantastic. It's the game Battlefield wants to be.

It's tough and will kick your ass, but it's such a blast to play. It's not perfect. The game never feels "stable," and stuff like ping is constantly all over the place across the board. But it doesn't really detract from the experience too much.  It's really a good time.

There are some aspects that aren't ideal. The community is pretty toxic at times, but it's not something that plagues the entire player base. There are also a lot of classes where you will not be able to play 99% of the time. A lot of the classes can only have a certain amount of people select it at once, and it's based on a mostly first come, first serve basis around how quickly you load into the game. If you don't have the best SSD & setup, prepare to play rifleman and whatnot most of the time. Even then, it's still great fun.

This review is based on experience playing RS2:V after EGA giveaway. If you grab game for free this might help you decide is it worth actually downloading.

It's my first realistic MMOFPS, I enjoyed it so much at first, I'd made a little research through guides and game history, and now ready to present my opinion.

IF IT WAS 2017, I'D RATE GAME 8 OR 9 OUT OF 10. BUT THERE ARE TO MANY "BUTS" NOW. As you could've guessed, FOR SHORT VERSION READ ONLY CAPS from now on.

GAME IS BASICALLY ABANDONED BY DEVELOPERS. That's it. It was free giveaway because company no longer interested in the game. Original developer team is long gone and had to be recontacted to do EGS-transfer and troubleshooting.
There is stuff just cut out from the game. It's three maps and M16A2. Game realistically doesn't have over 9000 guns, so it's really important. There are some balancing issues never to be resolved (Long Tan map for example). No event support at all (like Halloween). Graphics are just bad. No bulletholes on surfaces, you can't zero your gun properly while training. No internal guides, just two training areas, one of which being actual map, no ability to train with bots there. There are nasty bugs, I'd seen on 2017 videos and even 2015 CBT footages. Going prone and standing up can result in your legs being under the ground and you will limp excessively. In this condition, moving prone is the fastest way. If your helicopter crashed, you survived and some ally is near by, it mostly results in autokick from server for excessive team damage. There are of course some smaller bugs, but these two are the biggest pain.

CONTENT CREATORS ARE GONE. Basically no channels. Old guides with obsolete information. Placeholders, work-in-proogress, no longer supported everywhere.

PING IS HELL. Don't believe ping value of server in search. Multiply by at least 3, be ready for x4, expect x5. And magically 20 ping becomes 100. Sometimes, when we're losing, I check ping values of players. Losing team has higher values.

TO GET FULL GAME PAY EXTRA ~50$ MONTHLY. There are 2 types of servers. Official and private. Private costs money. You can't just create a room with setting, no-no, pay to third party. Official servers have some of only two game modes: Territory (capture the objective) and Supremacy (capture and hold for points). If you want to play Skirmish (team deathmatch), Campaign (consequent battles with its own rules) or Green Army Man DLC as Free Grunt (Territory and Supremacy) you have two options: go for someone's server hope for the best (ping, rules, community, quantity of players) or buy one for yourself and hope for the same best. Same applies for different settings (called mutators), like visibility of allied troops marks, making game more realistic.

GAMING COMMUNITY ****.
You get new players, that don't want to learn, grab most important classes, and try to play RS2V as generic MMOFPS, aiming for good K/D ratio, that they will never get, and not playing the objective.
On the other hand you have salty people that send anyone to training areas to learn to fly, for example. Well, it's really easy with 0 ms ping and when no one is firing at you.
Again, on some other hand you have kickers. They want your class just because. Or don't like you. Most notorious one changed team and kicked me. Why others agreed? I suppose, they thought "if votekick is going, it's definitely for a reason". So, I ask you, if you'll play, never votekick if you don't know the crime.
Just bad commanders.
Radiomen not sticking to commander and actually picking up this class just because it's a class. They don't even use the smokes.
Macrosusers atop this cake to definitely ruin your day.

This game - is a true work of art!
Although it is a banal shooting range for speed,
But, the music makes this experience unforgettable and infinitely replayable, I respect the composer, this "inducing" motive, which, after passing the middle of the game, becomes generally mad - it's incredible.
The plot here, most likely, is about a drug addict who is trying not to die and get out of the "binge", and, of course, there is not enough full-fledged story up to 10/10, but you can imagine any story convenient for you in your head, where the main character needs to run until the end and not die. Another flaw of the game for me is not very well-developed shooting, I completed game with a shotgun, it's much easier, but the "aim-challenge" is losted.
Well, I can also say that sometimes quite beautiful locations are generated, all the sounds are of high quality.
And yet, the game is quite easy, in fact, it takes 4-7 hours to complete, even if you don’t know how to shoot (again, shotgun helps you), lacks some kind of hardcore mode, but it would be even better to get the second part)

Хоть и представляет из себя банальный тир на скорость,

Сюжет тут, скорее всего, про наркомана, который пытается не умереть и выбраться из "запоя", и, полноценной истории до 10/10, конечно, не хватает, но вы можете представлять в голове любую удобную вам историю, где главному герою надо добежать до конца и не умереть. Gritty, raw, and unforgiving. Post Void is a perfect example of art direction and gameplay meeting abrasively (in the best way) to create a unique and whole experience. Better move at a break-neck speed and hit shots with pinpoint accuracy or you'll never reach the end. This was the most fun I've had playing a game in a long time, can't recommend enough.

Turbo Overkill is an excellent game that doesn't shy away from sending dopamine directly to your brain, I surprised myself playing the game Over and Over again without really thinking about it. The weapon roaster is extremely enjoyable to shoot and gibbing the enemies is music to my ears. Overall it's a more than competent game and Civvie should play Part 2.

GOOD SIDE
-Comfortable character control and fast fighting system.
-A story that does not take itself seriously is an aspect that makes me happy.
-Boss battles are good.
-Level design diversifies and develops in later sections.
-You can shape your play style with the new cybernetic and weapon modes that open.
-Beautiful music.

BAD SIDE
-Level design is shallow at the beginning.
-The feeling of hitting is weak.
-Some weapons are both weak and meaningless.
-The visuals sometimes hurt your eyes.

Hits hard, with killer gameplay and legit boomer shooter gunplay that reminds me of what the genre is all about. I don't play these games for the story or the visuals - I play them for the fun factor, and Turbo Overkill (for the most part...) excels.
Episode 1: 10/10
Episode 2: 7/10
Episode 3: 3/10
Might just be an example of too much being a bad thing, but by the time I hit ep3 I was kinda over it. Levels are all a bit long and my god these final boss fights are rough, with punishing lack of checkpoints etc. Still I'd say the fights are fun as hell, with all the movement tech the game provides coupled with furious guns blazing. Worth a play. Just be prepared to wonder how long the ride is going to last.

Uff, es un juego increíble.Tiene una historia minimalista, pero llena de personajes y de humor. El combate es extremadamente satisfactorio, tienes una serie de diversas armas para diferentes situaciones y con distintas habilidades que mejoras mientras juegas. También obtienes distintos elementos de tu equipo que te ayuda en la movilidad, así como en el **** diseño de niveles es excelente en su mayoría, hay uno que otro nivel que puede durar un poco más tiempo del que uno quiere y despúes hay otros que intentan diversificar las cosas añadiendo vehiculos y cosas así; algunos de estos ultimos funcionan bien, otros -en mi opinión-, no **** grafícas son bastante particulares, mezclan entre sprites, así como arte en tercera dimensión, eso sin contar lo bueno que es la banda sonora.Además, el juego tiene muchos secretos, modos de juegos extra, distintos trucos que uno puede desbloquear por medio de secretos, así como la habilidad de siempre poder volver a jugar cualquier nivel manteniendo su progreso; tiene un sistema universal de desbloqueo, entonces uno puede jugar el primer nivel con todas las armas y mejoras del ultimo, por ejemplo. Si no te gusta esto, siempre puedes empezar desde cero borrando tu **** general, es un juego de los mejores del género de disparos que han salido en epocas recientes.

I have not finished this game but I just really felt I had to say a few things about it.This is one of the greatest examples of what a small new studio with a brand new IP and a very limited budget can do when time and opportunity is given to people with incredible talent and video game design understanding. I have played so many shooters from huge AAA titles to AA to indies and truly very few can come even close to how this game is managing to capture the old school boomer shooter aesthetic while at the same time looking super modern and have amazing graphics. The combat is just so fast, so satisfying with some of the most spot on sound design and fps mechanics I've ever experienced.
It is the most fun I've had in a very long time plain and simple nothing more to it.

Really fun boomer shooter, where every weapon is fun to shoot, the enemies are varied enough to be interesting and the arena levels are okay. Level design is very poor, sadly, with unclear directions and it' frequently difficult to understand what the game wants from you. The ammo and health distribution is also an issue, there is no reliable way to get these from the enemies, unless they are fodder enemies. So it's not quite Doom Eternal level combat and some opponents fall into the bullet sponge category, but that's a small issue, since the game provides really fun weapons to engage with them.
Amazing retro style FPS. Hadn't had a fill of adrenaline like this since I finished Doom Eternal. Super recommended game!
Turbo Overkill AKA Chainsaw Man The Game 10/10.

Haven't had this much fun since ULTRAKILL and DOOM Eternal. The game looks amazing despite it's pixelated models, and the gunplay feels amazingly fun. When people say "Chainsaw Man", the first thing that comes to mind is Turbo Overkill.

Great world-building. Fantastic music. Creative level design. They nailed the feel of bouncing around in games like Quake, and built a genuinely creepy and fun game around it. 

My main complaint is that some weapons are objectively much better than others, so as things get harder you pretty quickly get forced into using the same couple of weapons while ignoring the rest. The games of this genre that I've enjoyed the most have revolved around switching between well-balanced weapons to take advantage of their various strengths, but that aspect just isn't here. 

Still a great game.
One of the best boomer shooters of nowadays. Some levels have pretty meh level design, but that's it!

After a little over 3 hours on DUSK, with having finished the first episode; I could confirm this game is incredible. The presentation is on point! The sound design, the soundtrack, the colour grading and general art style sells you the game's rural horror lovecraftian-ish **** combat design too are amazing. It took everything that made Quake worked and made it it's own thing! From the non-linear level design as well as the enemy boss fight **** easy 10/10 from me. An amazing addition to my gaming library, and a must-play for any fan of Boomer shooters.

This is a game that has to be played to understand why the reviews are so high. I watched videos and thought it looked neat, but it wasn’t really pulling me in. It sat in my library for over a year, and within 5 minutes of experiencing it, I understood. A couple days later, I finished the game, and what a wonderful treat for people who grew up with the original Quake. This game seriously captures the same energy of Quake without making the formula feel in any way dated. The gameplay is very simple, but it’s a nice refreshing throwback to when games required the fast paced run and gun movement rather than relying on cover. Where I think the game really shines is the atmosphere - who would have ever thought that this game with its intentionally retro graphics and play style would have a creepier atmosphere than many modern horror games. The initial part of the game gave me the atmospheric feeling of Resident Evil 4, except better. Some of the later sections of the game are truly unsettling. Between the beautiful yet extremely simple graphics and the phenomenal sound design, it helps tell the story of the game without the game actually having much of an overt story at all. Everything is told through the atmosphere and level design. It was actually pretty fun guessing what was going on and trying to create a story for yourself, since there is hardly any written or spoken dialogue. The sound design in this game is fantastic, a master in its class and it outsides most major modern horror games - especially some of the settings in the later portions of the game. It’s a pretty challenging game, but its highly rewarding. While it got frustrating at times, the satisfaction of pushing through a level and completing it after multiple tries was something I rarely experience in games anymore. The only flaw I would say is regarding some of the level design, which is true to the classic genre, but it didn’t age the best. I found myself lost pretty regularly because a lot of the textures and buildings look the same. Sometimes it allowed for some fun exploration, other times I was just running around for several minutes unable to figure out where I last saw something. There are a few really dark levels that were particularly irritating because of how difficult it was to find your way around. Overall, this is an excellent game that I think fans of the classics and modern shooter fans can both enjoy all the same. Everything this game sets out to do it excels at.

Overall a very fun, unique and interesting experience. The world of S#*t city is pungent, and fits exceptionally well with its art style (both in game and within the intro cutscene and accompanying art), atmosphere, tone and, best of all, the soundtrack. 
Gameplay is engaging. As you progress and complete challenges within missions, you acquire a new pair of trainers which give you modifiers which range from a second life, explosions when you kick doors, giving enemies big heads, etc. It bodes well for replayability. The game at its core isn’t so challenging, but when going for the challenge stars, it makes the game a lot more difficult. 

The thing I like the most about this game is the artstyle, music, atmosphere and setting, I think it all fits together exceptionally well, and gives a breath of fresh air to the genre. A unique experience, and something that will stay in my mind for a while. Highly recommend if you enjoy underground counterculture, pungent violence, somewhat challenging gameplay, and rave music

This game reminds me a lot of the Ghostrunner series where it's definitely a first person shooter/melee game but it's less about just shooting your way through levels and more about being precise. Feels more like a puzzle game to an extent than just a straightforward shooter. Definitely a game where it's all about trial and error and you will absolutely have to play a level multiple times to get your run down perfect. A little frustrating because of this and because it feels like a grind and I constantly feel like even if I am doing well I could get killed going through a new doorway and have to restart the whole level all over again. The music is great and it is kind of a ridiculous concept of the world run by gangs and you being the one guy who's not in a gang. Gameplay is super solid though which is bringing me back into it for sure. The random driving mechanics they threw in to the last two levels of the game totally threw me off and they were not intuitively controlled at all and that dropped the score for me because a solid shooter became a janky Drive Fest in the very last stretch of the game.

Superhot — это необычный шутер, который выделяется своим уникальным игровым процессом. Идея того, что время движется только тогда, когда двигаешься ты, заставляет продумывать каждый шаг и делает игру похожей на своеобразную стратегию в реальном времени. Атмосфера минимализма и яркий визуальный стиль тоже играют свою роль: красные враги на фоне белого окружения смотрятся стильно и придают всему происходящему особый шарм.Но, несмотря на оригинальность, есть моменты, которые могут надоесть. Кампания довольно короткая, а после прохождения основного сюжета остается не так много причин возвращаться. Кроме того, сама концепция замедления времени интересна, но в какой-то момент она перестает быть чем-то необычным и превращается в рутину.В итоге Superhot — это отличная игра для пары вечеров, но ее идеи не раскрываются в полной мере. Если вам интересен необычный взгляд на жанр шутеров, то она стоит внимания, но не ждите слишком глубокого опыта. 7 из 10.

I can't believe I wasted my time on this. Superhot is a total letdown. The "time moves when you move" mechanic gets old so fast, and the gameplay becomes a repetitive slog. The story is non-existent, the graphics are painfully dull, and there’s nothing here to keep you engaged for more than an hour. This game is overrated, and I can’t understand why anyone would recommend it. If you’re thinking about buying it, save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere. 2/10.

First off, let me just say that this game is a ******* nightmare. The whole concept of time only moving when you do sounds intriguing on paper, but in execution, it's just a headache-inducing mess. Trying to strategize and plan your moves while everything is frozen in place is enough to make anyone want to pull their hair out. And don't even get me started on those damn red men. They pop up out of nowhere, relentless in their pursuit to take you down. It felt like no matter what I did, they were always one step ahead, ready to dish out another frustrating defeat. In conclusion, "superhot" is a frustrating, infuriating mess **** that I would not recommend to my worst enemy. Save yourself the headache and the rage-inducing moments, and spend your time playing something actually enjoyable. Trust me, you'll thank me later.

Legends of Runeterra is a brilliantly designed online trading card game. Most importantly, LoR innovates game mechanics with a back-and-forth format that objectively make this game more tactical (but maybe less beginner-friendly) than its peers (like Hearthstone). With most actions that a player takes, the opponent has an option to respond, which often results in chains of actions with sometimes incredible comebacks/upsets. The artwork and animations are stellar, and the universe the game takes place in is advantaged by a rich legacy lore due to the producer's other products like League of Legends and Arcane. The game offers an incredible and near-endless PvE experience in addition to PvP: in fact, PvP has sadly taken a back-seat in the last couple years but is by no means dead as matches only take minutes to find. The future is difficult to predict and I hope that PvP will grow more as my heart will always be in PvP gameplay. Perhaps the most admirable quality of this game is its refusal to be "pay-to-win" as free cards and resources are given generously and consistently so that any player looking to play competitively can do so free of financial cost if they desire, at least for PvP. And that is something Hearthstone cannot boast.

A big problem I had was the card picking. Depending on your starting hand, and how you play it, will the computer "choose" the cards you pick up in your deck, I find in most cases. So at that point, it's only strategic for like, the first 25% of the round, and the next 5 - 7 mins is just the computer stalling to make the game longer, REGARDLESS of whether you are winning or losing. I felt this isn't an ACTUAL card game because you don't get your cards by chance, but the cards you pick up are heavily influenced by the (winning/losing) stance you are in (Losing = **** cards each round, winning = Stronger cards each round), The probability of getting certain cards is sealed depending on whether you are winning or losing, unlike REAL card games, the chance of getting any card is always 1 / Total number of cards.

The biggest let down for me are Bugs, Metaplay and communication.
Bugs appear on a dayli base and range from grafics glitches into others to cards wont work or you cant place them (even though i encountered gamebreaking bugs very rarely).

Power Creep is a huge problem in LoR, every patch, the new Cards are way more powerfull then the "older ones", either by having way better Stats/cost ratio or have the same stats but really good keywords.
The game makes no secret that it has its focus on fast games, thats why rush decks are Meta and lategame or control decks feel useless. E.g. Seamonsters needs you to throw 25 of your 40 cards away ,literally(!), to have theyr keyword work.
The only reason i do sometimes recommend it to some die hard League fans is its because its F2P.

Hikayesiyle, oynanışıyla, sanat tasarımıyla, şarkılarıyla, ses tasarımıyla çok güzel tam paket bir oyun. Oynanış JRPG tarzına parry ekleyerek çok güzel bir tat katıyor. JRPG kısmının derinliği aşırı değil ama gayet yeterli ve oyun boyunca sizi tutabiliyor. Parry sistemi de JRPG'lerin kaçınılmaz olarak düştüğü tekrardan kurtarıyor. Normalde JRPG'lerde bir yerden sonra ekrana bile bakmadan oynarsınız. İsterse Persona olsun ister Sea of Stars olsun, en iyisi bile bir yerden sonra eksik kalır. Ancak bu oyun o sınıra çarpsa da parry sistemi sürekli odaklı kalmanızı sağlıyor. Oynanış kısmında tek sıkıntı diyebileceğim kısım level scaling olmaması. Yan görevlere falan giderseniz çok güçleniyorsunuz ve ana hikayede her şeye tek atar hale geliyorsunuz. Yan içeriklerde gücünüze uygun düşmanlar var ancak ana hikaye seviyenizin çok gerisinde kalıyor. Oynayacaksanız önce ana hikayeyi bitirip sonra yan görevlere gitmeyi düşünebilirsiniz. Hikayesi çok güzel, hiç spoiler vermeyeyim ilk kez oynarken deneyimleyin. Sadece şunu söyleyeyim hikaye olay örgüsü olarak bence süper değil ancak karakterler asıl lezzeti veren şey. Sanat tasarımı, ses tasarımı zaten harika. Oyuna başladığınız andan itibaren sizde fark edersiniz. Çok güzel oyun, oynayın oynattırın. Ancak sıra tabanlı hiç çekemem ben diyorsanız tavsiye etmem.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a stunning masterpiece. Its painterly aesthetic feels alive, with animations that flow like brushstrokes in motion. The voice acting is exceptional, giving every moment emotional weight. But the real highlight is the innovative combat system—fluid, strategic, and refreshingly original. A rare blend of beauty and brilliance.

Graphics and animations are also very nice. Unfortunately, no native FSR4 support - but nothing OptiScaler can't fix.

I feel very lucky to be privileged to be able to be playing this game (currently 80+ hours in). It's a one-of-a-lifetime thing i think. Easily gamef the decade. I didn't even know i like JRPG turn-based, but this game opens your eyes and ruins every other game for you.

This game reminded me of the magical feeling when I first play Final Fantasy. It offers an experience you will only get once every 5 years or so. 
The art design breathe life into the world; everything looks amazing and stylish. 
The music fits perfectly with the scene and elevated the experience to a whole new level. Even listening by themselves, they are phenomenal track.
The story has the best hook in all of gaming and lots of unexpected twist and turn along the way. The story deals with serious theme but knowing when to add funny moment, there's never a tonal inconsistency throughout the gameplay. 
The addition of dodge and parry to the game, a simple addition, but combining with terrific boss animation, makes the combat experience very engaging and enjoyable.
Overall, a game you must experience in your lifetime.

Bought this game with the expectations of getting the masterpiece, the best game ever made, the true ultimate legend ****. Instead I got huuuge disappointment and wasted dozens of euros. I got a game with falsely described genre, a game with shallow characters, a game which is now a new king of running simulators, as there is literally nothing else to do, you just run, and then you fight, and then run again, and fight, and run, and fight, .... I was told it was great turn-based game with real-time mechanics, instead I got QTE game, but with control over up to 3 characters (so I did QTE in turns for them). Combat is also extremely unbalanced, as literally just parrying can win every single fight in this game, while missing a dodge or parry in later stages of the game means instant fail, team death and reset from last save. This is tied to abilities and perk-buy management. There are multiple distinct abilities (at least the text is different), however because of the lack of game balance I mentioned previously, it actually does not matter what abilities does player pick, as dodging or parrying perfectly is the only singular requirement to win every single fight in the entire game without any exceptions. Adding to that, this results in excesive repetitivness of gameplay. Next up, I was expecting bit of a roleplaying (that is this "RP" in RPG), but I got no dialogues at all while playing the game (except for the camp, there I was able to read few lines of dialogues, and except for cutscenes, obviously). Many praised this game for story, but somehow I got another cheap premise with rushed second half of the story. The idea was good though, just the execution was simply bad. Nonchalant "cute" cutscenes did not fit the narrative and were breaking the "immersion" for me, although immersion is veeeery strong word to use here, as this game does not deliver immersion of any kind. The same goes for OST, which was quite good, however some anime-like combat bangers absolutely did not fit the atmosphere at all. Last but not least I will mention the visuals, which are as good as in any UE5 game, so nothing special there, but nothing to complain about either, except for two things - 1) developers tried to make every environment special, unique and distinct, but the result is quite the opposite as all the locations feel simmilar in every way except for colours used in them; and 2) glitches were EVERYWHERE.

In conclusion, the hype around this game is as artificial as it gets, driven by "30 devs" story, which is also not true. This game has nothing much to offer for people with some standards. If you like empty corridors, endless running and QTE, this is a game for you. Objectively, if this was not advertised as "game of the generation" I would give this game like 4/10, however, I expected 100x more from advertised "masterpiece" and ended up deeply disappinted, like I probably never was before.
Obra maestra. No hay adjetivos para describir este juego, es perfecto. Todo el mundo debería probarlo.

This was my first time playing a game with turn-based combat, and I was completely hooked. The amount of freedom is incredible—whatever you can imagine, you can actually do. Between the massive variety of dialogue choices and the fact that every NPC is killable, the possibilities feel endless. This game is a must-play. It is easily one of the top 3 RPGs, if not the best, I've ever played.

To be frank I didn't enjoy it as much as other people did. Yes, it's very fun and deep game, yet it's just RPG that we had back in 2000. All critical acclaim comes from the fact that we don't have such games anymore.

A ce jour, la meilleur adaptation de D&D en jeu vidéo. Une campagne à l'écriture impeccable, des personnages attachants et des graphismes superbes. Le jeu mérite son titre de GOTY 2023, même si il n'est pas sans quelques **** défauts. Le rythme est assez lent, rien ne se fait rapidement. La musique est parfaite et s'écoute avec plaisir, mais la caméra devient parfois horrible à gérer. La difficulté est bien équilibrée, mais certains affrontements sont un véritable cauchemar en terme de stratégie... Pour ce qui est de l'équipement et des objets magiques, c'est un vrai capharnaüm. Pour le reste... Ce jeu est d'un richesse incroyable !

i was pretty scared to play this since it was not my type of game. but man… what a PEAK game. the amount of freedom this game gives you, i dont think theres another one near in terms of freedom. definitely top 3 games of decade with expedition 33 and elden ring

Baldur’s Gate 3 gilt für viele als das beste Rollenspiel der letzten Jahrzehnte – und das völlig **** Spiel verbindet unglaubliche Charaktertiefe, intensive Entscheidungen, perfekte Atmosphäre, fantastisches Writing und ein taktisch brillantes Kampfsystem zu einem einzigartigen Erlebnis, das man sonst nirgendwo bekommt.Jede Entscheidung hat echte Konsequenzen, jede Figur wirkt lebendig, und die Welt reagiert glaubwürdig auf das Handeln des Spielers. Die Freiheit, Situationen kreativ zu lösen – sei es diplomatisch, chaotisch, brutal, schlau oder komplett verrückt – macht jeden Durchlauf anders und **** seiner epischen Story, den emotionalen Momenten, großartigen Begleitern und dem riesigen Umfang setzt Baldur’s Gate 3 neue Maßstäbe für RPGs.Fazit: Ein Meisterwerk, das mehr bietet als die meisten Spiele in fünf Jahren zusammen. Für viele das beste Rollenspiel aller Zeiten.

Vous arrivez dans un temple ou a lieu une cérémonie précédant un enterrement. Différents choix de dialogues s'ouvrent à vous :- Mes condoléances. Qui était ce ?- Magnifique prestation des choristes, ce sont les funérailles les plus réussies auxquelles j'ai pu assister !- Joli cadavre ! qu'est ce qu'on fête ?...Enfin un vrai RPG avec des véritables options de dialogues et des vrais conséquences sur le long terme. Votre personnage de base, votre race, votre historique, et les relations que vous avez noués avec les autres personnages de l'aventure, tout ça influe sur les options de dialogues et c'est super ! Les personnages sont bien écrits et attachants, on a l'embarras du choix pour se construire son équipe, quand on a pas 3 amis avec qui jouer. Il faudrait faire le jeu au moins deux fois pour en profiter, notamment pour pouvoir être un véritable méchant une fois dans sa vie, être violent sans raison et dominer le monde ! J'ai eu beaucoup de mal avec les combats au tour par tour, encore plus façon DnD. Un enfer au début mais on s'y fait et ça devient un plaisir d'en maîtriser les subtilités à la fin. Et putain les missclicks à 3 mm du perso et tu tapes dans le vide et tu perds ton tour, ou bien tu sautes dans un gouffre sans fond quel enfer.N'allez pas vous spoilez sur internet, vous le regretterez. Et abusez du F5 (sauvegarde rapide). Il y a quelques rares sauvegardes automatiques, et après chaque campement mais ca reste rare. Et franchement juste le F5 pour tester les options de dialogues ca vaut le coup .

Hades 2 is a very disappointing for such a highly anticipated sequel. The gameplay is still solid, but it feels too much familiar. The story moves too slowly, and the new features don’t really change much. Some bosses feel frustrating rather than challenging. Too bad,  the first game set the bar so high.

Hades II looks great at first glance, but once you dive in, the cracks show. The combat is messy, progression feels sluggish, and the magic of the first game just isn’t there. It’s not terrible, but it’s nowhere near the masterpiece its predecessor was.

I loved the first Hades, but the sequel feels like a step back. The pacing is slow, fights are unbalanced and drag on with spongey enemies, and the new characters lack the charm of the original cast. Technically it’s rough too, with performance drops and clunky controls. Instead of fresh ideas, it often feels like recycled content packaged as a new game.

Got it gifted to me after watching two of my friends froth out the mouth over it and uhhhhh it's fine. Sure, the graphics are really polished and the high speed gameplay is really engaging, but the music and voice lines are legitimately so annoying to me that I've just been playing with most of the audio muted. Not to mention, some of the enemies themselves often end up turning the combat into feeling more akin to something like Contra with the infuriating amount of bullets and attacks being thrown at you. Most of the actual gameplay itself is fine, but there's definitely more I dislike than enjoy.

this game is one of the worst roguelikes in terms of gameplay. It's literally Click-Click Dash. You just click on enemies from afar, and the game takes the worst aspects of combat in isometric games - the enemies are dumb, there are a lot of them, and they're so fat that you have to click on them for about 30 seconds. The gameplay is terrible, there's no depth, and there's nowhere to explore. The build system is the same - there's no variety or depth to the build - you choose one thing and focus on that for the entire run, because if you try to focus on multiple things, you won't have enough damage. It hurts me to see that many people consider this game to be one of the best roguelikes. It's not a bad game, but it's a shame for the genre as a roguelike. It's a roguelike for those who have never played a roguelike before.

Acho um jogo que tem uma boa proposta de sobrevivência em um apocalipse zumbi, entregando um mundo aberto extenso, com diversos recursos e possibilidades para se explorar.
Mecânicas interessantes que fazem muita coerência e realismo para o game.
O multijogador funciona bem, joguei sem ter problemas. Sistema de paty, pvp e distribuição de recursos funcionais. Torna o jogo muito mais divertido.

O jogo não tem uma história para explicar aquele mundo, existem muitos bugs que podem atrapalhar a experiência do jogador, o jogo é mal otimizado, pouca variedade de designer dos zumbis comuns, os gráficos deixam a desejar em vários aspectos, uma interface pouca intuitiva para o jogador e comandos que o jogador não consegue modificar.
Sound effects bem duvidosos e mal distribuídos em muitos momentos.

Eu sou apaixonado pelo game, mas eu entendo os seus defeitos e fiz uma análise que acredito ser coerente e sincera.

Y como no pienso repetir una reseña de 15 líneas lo pondré fácil: Este juego es una basura absoluta, pero no tan basura como metacritic.

7 Days to Die suffers from significant optimization issues, making it challenging to run smoothly on anything below a mid-range GPU, typically priced around $500. This necessitates setting graphics to low for acceptable performance. The gameplay experience is marred by a cumbersome and perplexing interface. Base construction, for instance, can be particularly frustrating; any mistakes require players to manually dismantle structures, a time-consuming process that hampers creativity and expansion efforts. Additionally, the zombies exhibit an uncanny ability to detect the player from great distances, which can become exceedingly bothersome. In comparison, other survival games like "Project Zomboid" and "Valheim" offer a more polished and enjoyable experience. Unless you relish frustration, it might be best to look elsewhere for your survival game fix.

This game goes beyond merely crafting an engaging story—it breathes life into its character. Rather than simply stating that someone is struggling with inner conflict, it takes the bold step of showing you exactly what’s happening inside his mind.

Disco Elysium is a masterpiece of video games. And a strong contender for one of the best RPGs ever made. It’s one of the few games that manages to make political commentary that is compelling, funny, and digestible to anyone reading it regardless of affiliation. All the while supplementing it with hilarious slapstick comedy and humor, as well as a thrilling whodunit murder plot. Not one aspect of this game can be criticized, becides maybe one instance where you can miss some of the best end game content due to a failed dice roll
Revolutionizes narrative RPGs with unmatched writing and reactive storytelling. A cerebral experience like no other.

Are all the critics on a rush of putting anything intellectual and different as game of the year? I just got done playing Journey (late on the PC) and was just as puzzled as to how that was game of the year.This is standard point-and-click adventure gaming, absolutely nothing ground-breaking apart from just good writing. If you like that sort of thing and love reading books of that style, you'll enjoy it I suppose.

The only difference is it's much longer than your standard adventure game, more depth in the skills and the dialogue just goes on and on. Half a million lines they say? Do I really want to read all that? Much of it is just pointless dribble. You have all these inside voices that speak, but it's not really that interesting. The most interesting dialogue in the whole game was the humour from the two kids near the start and the ringing the police station.

The art/design is all beautiful. But it's still stuck in an overhead isometric camera view. For sure if they had a AAA budget they would do a third-person mouse look, that's far more immersive. Can you imagine watching a movie, or even a 20 hour TV series, where its just this one view above their heads? It would be laughed at. But somehow, 40 years since the start of the isometric point and click, we're still stuck on this low budget camera angle. You never see the characters faces. Even in the small picture frame you get of the characters, which often barely resemble the model on-screen, it's just a static picture. The main character never even has a voice, and your sidekick is deadpan in everything he says. This is lacking in any expression or emotion. When you only have the budget to do a single isometic angle, this simply can't be a 9+/10. You'll also have to fight through sluggish movement, constantly bumping into invisible walls absolutely everywhere trying to work out the small path to walk. I even had a few game ending bugs that I had to reload from.

The overall gameplay revolves around slowly walking back and forth for hours clicking things until something happens in the game, because it's often unclear what you're supposed to do so you just have to click everything, exhaust every dialogue tree, until one of the many missions you have resolves something so you can continue. You'll get a dialogue dead-end where you don't have the skills or research necessary to continue, so you do random tasks to unlock it, or reload the game over and over until you pass the check my chance. I also didn't load a lot into the skills because it's so unclear what's really going to help, as well as how many skill points you have. So I just left it until the end game to when I thought I would need them, but I still didn't. I'd probably only used 5 skills points throughout the game.

The skill sets and requiring certain skills, items and tasks to be completed to unlock dialogue is still a nice idea overall and I'm not sure how you could tweak it to make it better. But a 9/10, nope.

What was good about most of the game was the story, which had me continuing to play it to see how in unravelled. But in the end, without spoilers, the conclusion really had absolutely nothing to do with anything up till that point and just felt like the writer didn't have any idea how to finish it so just threw something in there to wrap things up. A major disappointment.

This is a nice simple point and click adventure, but it goes on for far too long. Over 20 hours I spent on it and was ready for it to be over before then. The highlights for me are just seeing a nice new area of the map. It's not the mountains of dialogue, the story that was never properly concluded, or the very basic puzzle solving. But I can see much better looking design in a full 3D game and countless adventure games already look this beautiful.

I'd give it a 7/10. I think the critics have just forgotten what normal adventure games are like and got all hung  up on intellectual dialogue and skill trees.

Disco Elysium is more than a game Disco Elysium is a unique detective game where you live the life of an amnesiac alcoholic, investigate a murder and make moral choices that determine everything. The game is like a book, where every day is a new chapter, and the characters come to life thanks to their vivid characters and unforgettable dialogues. The world is filled with details: from key items and weapons to the little things that affect the development of the plot. You are given complete freedom to be whoever you want to be, make decisions and build your character. This game is suitable for those who want to feel the atmosphere of a real detective, dive into a deep story and feel responsibility for every choice.
Un chef-d'oeuvre savamment écrit et un RPG culte pour les années à venir ! Un système intuitif et des personnages attachant. Un banger.

Hardcore, hardcore to the mega! This is the closest we got to Planescape: Torment in decades. Fantastic world building, story, art and music. It’s a click & read type game, no fluid gameplay and even years after release, there are still many technical glitches, so it’s definitely not for everyone, but if you give it a shot it will reward you with extremely unique experience and atmosphere that you won’t forget. 9/10

This is not a game. It's a text simulator filled with pseudo intellectual trash that doesn't make sense. It reads like a college freshman in a sociology class' essay. I suppose if you are into that you can play this and feel "smart".

Seriously. You click around and read text that's poorly written. That's it.

First of all, it's not an rpg. Second, it's not a good game as a quest either. There are no interesting characters or plot. Literally none of the choices are thought-provoking. The only good thing about this game is its interesting original visual style. But even it's basically just a recolor from a bunch of other similar quests

Oh I love RPGs with a lot of text! - I thought and sat down to play this game. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. Lots of text, zero meaning. Brain gum for pseudo-intellectuals. Moreover, this is not an RPG. This is one long drawn out quest. Like one from Skyrim where you have to track down a maniac in Windhelm, you know =) And there is absolutely no RPG component here. You can't create a character. And even the characteristics don’t affect anything (otherwise why are the “stupid” character’s lines NOT different from the other 2 branches? You can’t choose normal options in dialogues, because they simply don’t exist, and those that exist don’t affect anything (try not to wake up in the first dialogue, for example). But there will be a bunch of texts about what to do with material things. WHAT IS THIS, A TEXT SIMS??? The characters are worthless, there is literally no empathy for anyone, because they are just only cardboards - decorations for the riots and tomfoolery of the main character. By the way, the humor here is also bad. The level of marginal drunks. The setting is certainly unusual, but damn, even in The Wolf Among Us there are more plot RPG elements. The only thing I can praise Disco for is that it’s interesting an original avant-garde visual. This is where its merits end

I played the game and it was definitely one of the worst and boring games I've ever seen and I deleted it. It's not a game, it's more like an e-book.

First of all, this is not an open world game. I have no idea how it can be marketed like this, have the makers ever seen an open world game? The NPCs do nothing but sleep at night and the world is a small and frankly empty map. It's static and dead and never changes. It's not even a world, let alone an open world.

It's not a real RPG either. Yes, you have stats and inventory and dice rolls, but that's it. Also, these are just game mechanics, there's a skill tree and inventory like in a lot of games, but they don't make a game an RPG game, and there's no real choice, because the whole difference is tied to dialog options, which you'll click on anyway, further destroying the role-playing part, and for a lot of things, choosing to do something will actually be a dice roll, and the mechanics of retrying the roll are overly complicated and too overwhelming to take the time.

No matter what you do, you'll be dragged towards a single ending, which makes sense since it's a murder mystery, but as a player you have no choice, the only real choice is at the character creation screen, and from that point on it's pretty much set how you're going to play the next 30-40 hours of the game, which is filled with dialog just to drag it out.

Yes, you can click on options in dialog windows, but the game will decide for you whether that happens or not, and it will mostly depend on your character's stats and some modifiers. Yes, again, it's an RPG mechanic, but as a player, you don't really get to choose anything or do anything.

An example **** where your choices really matter would be Detroit Become Human. Or even Witcher 3. Disco Elysium is nowhere near that level, Detroit is already not an RPG game, Witcher 3 is not a pure RPG, but supposedly Disco Elysium was marketed as open world and a pure RPG, but it's not even half as successful as those games.

In short, Disco Elysium is not a game to be played even if it's free. I never understood what they liked about this game. It is one of the most overrated games of recent years.
The game is incredibly fun, well worth the price, and offers some surprising gameplay toward the end. It’s definitely worth completing to experience the True Ending

One on hand an incredibly good old school turn based RPG and on the other they use a lot of design choices I dislike. It is inspired by old RPGs like Chrono Trigger / Chrono Cross. You can play as Valere or Zale who are Solstice Warriors. If you are born on summer or winter solstice you are special and can unlock sun or moon magic. Back in the past an evil alchemist named the Fleshmancer developed near godlike powers and nearly destroyed the world. His creations the Dwellers still exist and are only vulnerable on Eclipses to sun and moon magic. The story starts with Zale and Valeres training to become Solstice warriors and evolves to a fight to the fate of the world. The story and characters are superb. I felt the emotions and impacts the character face. I struggled with them and it was an intense feeling. The story evolves and has many surprises and turns. I think it is some of the best stuff in years. The gameplay is a bit mixed. I feel bad for mentioning it as it could just be not my taste. The turn base battles have a gimmick. Special attacks by the enemies can be nullified. Locks are displayed when an enemy cast a special attack. For example a moon and sword symbol. If you attack with a moon and sword attack (or both) before the counter reaches zero the attack is nullified. Normal attacks create mana orbs which can be used to power up your actions. Each character has his/her unique elements and used mana orbs are converted to their mana types.  Now to the choices I dislike. Your level ups are rare and give not much stat wise. You are give a choice to boost some stats on each level up but that makes not much difference. At the time I was in the final dungeon I was just on level 23 with a lot of grinding. They also don't want you to power level. The experience points from battle decrease on each level up. Also the true ending requires a lot of effort that feels like a chore. Here I had a bug that prevents me from getting it. Luckily there is YouTube. Finally the resource management is a bit of a chore too. You can switch to auto heal after each battle which gives a total different gaming experience. If not you have a boring cycle of collecting food and cooking to replenish health. Sadly you have a very limited storage for cooked items. The Wheels mini game is really nice and I enjoyed it. The presentation is superb. The graphics look really great and the soundtrack is memorable. Overall I ended up enjoying the game even with its flaws. I give an 8/10 because lower or higher feels wrong for me.

Is a 8 **** itself but the postlaunch care put it in a solid nine. The dedevelopers have studied and refresh old school ideas to keep their game nostalgic but fresh. The combat never gets old and the world feels like a platformer somehow. Is also a lesson of pixel art

Superbe petit jeu, graphisme old school, systéme de combat au tour par tour dynamique avec des parades, des attaques a améliorer via la pression du bouton action au bon moment, ce qui rend les affrontements vraiment interressant. L'exploration est assez sympathique, beaucoup de petites enigmes, puzzles a résoudre pour trouver des coffres secrets ou juste avancer dans l'histoire, excellente surprise que ce RPG old school.

O Sabotage Studio, como em "The Messenger", conseguiu criar uma história cativante, cheia de reviravoltas, personagens carismáticos e uma trilha sonora absurda de boa. Só não dou 10/10 por conta do combate ser um pouco simples em algumas situações. De resto, jogo incrível.
Exactly what I have been searching for as a follow up to Chrono Trigger from my younger days. Great story, art, and especially the music.
