The Scorn of Dark Souls clones. It's a 7 from me but a high 7 (green rather than the default yellow colour).  The aesthetics are oppressive and beautiful. The slow methodical exploration and figuring out what to do is way more obtuse than Dark Souls but has a similar feeling of reward.  I'd argue that the mechanics are a little too obtuse and that as a result I didn't commit to any other playstyle rather than my starting one, but the sense of being lost in an aggressive dream-like world is very strong.  The combat for me was repetitive and sluggish and the bosses aren't the best I've seen.  For me the game shines in it's 3 main 'dungeons', and the genuinely scary 'run-backs' to base camp after killing the bosses.  As others have said the long animations and clunkyness are what hold it back, despite it clearly being intended to give the impression of heft - it does but at a cost.

The game is skeletal and not very fleshed out but still is fun.

Don't expect to want to play all the time but is a really good first-time playthrough and should last 6-10 hours. It is fun to revisit and is worth it if you're ok with not playing a ton.

The game is a bit of a maze if you just wander so use the visions or you might want to look up a quick playthrough.

The biomes are great and are designed so that you don't spend too much time in them so they don't get repetitive too quickly.

Everything that isn't a boss isn't as fun to fight though. Mechanics are fun but I try to avoid using the hardening ability to make it feel less choppy.

The lore is interesting but there isn't a lot to it when playing through unless you dig for it. If you want lore, playthrough, and level as Solomon.

Music is good enough and sets the tone of the game.
É um bom jogo para iniciar em jogos estilo souls, as batalhas contra chefes não são tão desafiadoras...

Soulslike oyunlara getirdiği bazı yenilikler olsa da combat'taki tekrar eden yapısı, düşman çeşitliliğindeki eksiklik, boss'ların çok az hareketinin olması, combat keskinliğinin düşük olması gibi nedenlerle o kadar da beğenmedim. Dar alanlarda üzerine çok sayıda gönderilen düşmanlar bence oyunun ritmine ve hızına uygun olmamış.

Sertleşme muhabbeti ilginç. Kalkan gibi ama tekrar kullanmak için bir kaç saniye beklemek gerekiyor. Kabuk denilen cesetleri bulup artık o karakter olarak oynama fikri de ilginç olmuş. İstediğiniz zaman oyun stiliniz tamamen değiştirebiliyorsunuz. Ama bir ritim tutturduktan sonra her düşmanı ve hatta her boss'u aynı taktikle kesiyorsun zaten. Başta alışması zor oldu ama sonunda oynadığım en kolay soulslike oyundu.

Item'ları bir kez kullanmadan ne işe yaradığını bilemiyorsunuz. İlk kullanış genelde boşa gidiyor yani, beğenmedim. Bir de item'lıar belli bir sayıda kullanınca aşinalık kazanıp daha çok verim alıyorsunuz, iyi bir özellik.

Haritası bu kadar karmaşık bir oyun görmedim.  Bir de ana boss'ları kesip bir item alınca aynı yolu siste ve karanlıkta dönme fikri çok saçma olmuş.

Neticede iyi veya kötü olmayan ortalama bir iş. Souls açlığı çekenler faydasını görür ama beklenti düşük olmalı.

Desde la perspectiva de un SoulsLike, es excelente su gameplay y ambientacion, tanto como sus mecanicas originales y unicas, tambien es un juego muy versatil a la hora de tu poder cambier de estrategia para un boss o alguna zona en concreto. Pero donde pierde es en la variedad de sus Bosses y enemigos, algo aceptable teniendo en cuenta que no es un juego triple A, pero donde NO me gusto para nada y por lo cual no le doy mas punto es en su Jefe final, es realmente decepcionante.

He jugado a juegos malos, lentos, tediosos, que no cargaban bien los personajes, con combates aburridos y sin sentido, con parrys malos o inútiles, con escudos inservibles, juegos donde el prota es lento y torpe o donde hay muchísimo delay en las acciones, frustrantes, donde los enemigos te ven desde muy lejos y te atacan, juegos donde los enemigos que normalmente tienen poca vida, tienen más que de costumbre, juegos liosos, sin historia, sin lore, incluso juegos sin sentido, pero este se lleva la palma! A parte de todo lo anterior, no he jugado un souls más malo en mi vida, menos mal que me salió gratis. Parece sencillamente una demo (sin acabar) de un juego, los enemigos no cargan bien, el combate es monótono y aburrido, el parry no sirve de mucho, los objetos y cosas que salen en la pantallas de carga ni siquiera te sirven como consejo o para enterarte de algo, parece claramente que ni lo han testeado, tienes varias armas y no vas a pasar de la principal (la tengo al máximo y el resto todavía no puedo tenerlas ni a la mitad de nivel), las mejoras de los personajes no tienen sentido (porque no son mejoras; hay un ataque que si te conviertes en piedra en el aire haces mucho daño al caer, pero no puedes ni saltar ni caer por los sitios, ¿para que he gastado monedas y vestigios? todavía no he podido usar el ataque) y estas mejoras no se aplican bien (por ejemplo no hay otra oportunidad al matar muchísimos enemigos o no te curas al conseguir vestigios, aunque diga que aumenta la probabilidad de conseguir vestigios los enemigos no sueltan más, etc.), no he visto nada del tráiler en el juego, ni las velocidades de los personajes, ni las habilidades, ni nada de todo lo chulo que parece que promete y además de todo esto, es injusto y muy corto. Está sin pulir, con controles que en mando dejan bastante que desear, controles de cámara bastante malos, esquivas contra una pared que no sabes que está porque no ves a tu alrededor, hay muchos objetos que no son destruibles ni movibles y te entorpecen la batalla (como las tiendas) y muchísimo delay, no tiene nada de profundidad ni en el mapa ni en la historia (no sabes porqué haces nada, no tiene ningún sentido ni motivación detrás, ¿salvo el mero hecho de explorar?) ni con los enemigos (ni con nada), te lo puedes pasar prácticamente corriendo todo el rato y evitando un montón de peleas (son mejores las peleas contra boses que contra los enemigos normales, tienen más sentido). El tema de la familiaridad, que me parece algo innovador, queda totalmente opacado por el resto de cosas (lo pondría como algo "bueno", pero ni si quiera). Los vestigios se quedan en cada armadura (o shell) lo que genera que cuando te cambies de una a otra para mejorarlas, te lleves una desagradable sorpresa, además de obligarte a manejar una clase de personaje que igual no es tu estilo y te deja con clases/armaduras a medio mejorar. Para usar las "habilidades", necesitas determinación, que consigues al rellenar unas barras tipo stamina en los combates pegando enemigos.... pero si dejas de combatir y no has rellenado lo suficiente la barra, desaparece y se vacía (cosa que pasa bastante porque no quieres estar todo el rato peleando), las mejoras de las armas no puedes comprarlas, debes encontrarlas, pero tampoco sirven de mucho ya que consumen muchísima determinación (hasta el parry la consume, quitando un personaje, el resto casi no tienen barras de determinación y no es algo ampliable, encima esta es una de las cosas top que aparecen en el tráiler, pero it's a trap.) En consecuencia a todo esto, el precio base me parece una pasada y que los DLC sean de pago me parece todavía más basto. Hablando de esto último parece ser que han metido en el DLC una 5ª clase al estilo pay to win. No sé de donde habrán sacado nada para hacer el 2, pero espero que sea mucho mejor que esto. Un juego estilo souls no es un juego frustrante, desquiciante, austero o con mecánicas injustas o limitadas, son juegos que te ponen a prueba y con bastante dificultad pero te permiten mediante mecánicas a tu alcance poder probar diferente modos de combate y demás, pero este no lo hace. No sé si es que las nuevas generaciones se conforman con cualquier cosa mediocre (o con cualquier plagio, ya que intenta desesperadamente parecerse a Dark Souls), pero creo que deja bastante que desear. Como culmen de todo esto, además, tiene bugs... No se lo recomendaría ni a mi peor enemigo. Por sacarle algo bueno, los gráficos no están mal (y eso es gracias a UE4) y las canciones del laúd. No pretendo que esta crítica sea un ataque al juego, es simplemente mi experiencia con el mismo y lo que me ha transmitido (decepción). Lo probé desde la beta y ahora que han pasado varios años y lo he vuelto a probar esperando alguna mejora, me he encontrado con lo mismo que en la beta.

Theres barely anything redeemable about the game

###  **Mortal Shell – A Soulslike That Forgets the “Like” Part**I picked up *Mortal Shell* looking for that classic Soulslike experience — intense combat, memorable bosses, and rich, atmospheric dungeons. What I got instead was a glorified running simulator with the worst dungeon design I’ve ever seen in a video ****’s break it down: **Dungeon Design? More Like Labyrinthine Headache**I spent more time running around in circles than actually fighting enemies. The level layout is so confusing and poorly thought out that I constantly found myself ending up in the **same area I just came from**, only from a different angle — as if someone twisted a maze and forgot to label the exit. Some sections are so large and **completely empty** that I genuinely wondered if I glitched into unfinished areas. Zero enemies, zero atmosphere, just giant hallways for no reason. Whoever designed these environments seriously needs to reconsider their career.️ **Combat: The Lone Shining Light… If You Can Reach It**Boss fights were decent, I’ll give the game that. But the journey to get to them? **An absolute joke.** You’ll have to run a **marathon-length trek** through those same confusing, enemy-scarce hallways just to get back to a boss if you die. No shortcuts, no reasonable respawn points — just a big ol' middle finger to your time and patience. **Item Descriptions? Nah, Figure It Out Yourself**You want to know what an item does? Too bad! *Mortal Shell* gives you **zero info** unless you use the item first — and once you waste it, well, that's just your loss. No forgiveness, no hints, just frustration. This isn't challenge; it's **bad design** dressed up as mystery.🪖 **Shells Are Cool… Until You Try Upgrading**The Shell system — where you can possess different fallen warriors with their own strengths and weaknesses — is actually a **great idea**. It gives you flexibility and encourages experimenting with different playstyles. Unfortunately, the **skill upgrades are mostly trash**. You’ll waste precious resources unlocking garbage-tier perks that barely change anything. What’s the point of customization if it’s not worth the investment? **Final Verdict: Save Your Time, Save Your Sanity**I spent like $2 on this, and honestly, that feels like $1.50 too much. If you’re craving a Soulslike, **replay Dark Souls, Bloodborne, Sekiro**, or even other indies like *Lies of P* or *Nioh*. *Mortal Shell* is **not worth your time**, no matter how cheap it is.️ My Advice: **DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.**Save yourself the pain. Unless you want a walking simulator with a sprinkle of combat and a whole lot of bad design, steer clear.

Wasted potential. There is no enemy variety, the map is monotonous, checkpoints are insufficient, fast travel should have been accessible from the very beginning of the game. We shouldn't have to collect health replenishing items over and over again.

The atmosphere was definitely done correctly but my god is there a lot of jank in this game. Bosses disappearing mid fight so you have to reset. Hardening not working. Mobs not spawning in until they have already shot their arrows at you. Mobs not spawning in until you walk past the spot where they usually are and then spawning in behind you. The list goes on.

And what do Playstack do? They introduce patches that only patch out the speedrunner strats. Why?

It wouldnt be so bad if the boss fights were at least fun after the slog of going through the janky world. But no. Two of the four main bosses have about 3 moves only and the other 2 are gimmick fights.

Not worth checking out unless you are really into the souls-like genre, if even then.

This takes every mechanic from a soulsborne, and misunderstands them completely.

Leveling: you don't. There are no stats to speak of in this regard, or rather, you start "level evened" with your enemies and it stays that way. You'd think this is a good thing, but it absolutely is not.  You have "shells" (which you have to find). It's basically a class with extra steps, and you can't develop that class outside its bounds- like giving the no-stamina tank some stamina, or the no-HP rogue some HP.  They're stuck with those stats.

You purchase sidegrades for these shells, of which only half per shell actually relate to combat in any way, and three are universal between shells. Each shell has to have their tree unlocked *individually.*  "oh that's not so bad!" wrong. There's only four. If your playstyle doesn't fall into one of these four ideas the devs had for you, you're S.O.L. It also means that if you DO find one that's your playstyle, and you unlock the stuff you want, the EXP resource of the game becomes completely obsolete besides buying consumables.  There is no fear of death besides having to go back to the starting area of that zone.

Parrying: Parrying isn't a normal thing. It's attached to an item you have to locate. This item needs to be charged in segments, by dealing damage. If you don't, it doesn't work.  If you don't fill the segment, it decays.  Half the enemies in the game ignore parrying anyway, because "they hit too hard" or -surprise- it was actually a throw attack and you were supposed to I-frame it with a dodge. This leads to healing.

Healing: Awful.  Parrying when it's charged, and consumables you have to find in the wild.  No, they are not blood vials- blood vials you have a max you can carry and they actually work. In Mortal Shell, the consumables that heal worth anything tend to remove the resource that lets you parry. Yes, you read that right.  Healing, removes your ability to both parry & by extension, heal more.  By the way, that resource is also the resource used for special moves.  So if you ever have to heal, you can't use special attacks, because those attacks cost so much of the resource, and your healing just deleted that resource.

Weapons: There's only four weapons. Three of them are big beefy two-handers your character swings like they're just waking up. The only short weapon that swings "fast" is dual-wielded, and only does full damage if both weapons in the attack animation hit. This dual attack swing has the same overall attack speed as the big two handers with none of the range.  In addition, all the weapons seem to do the same general damage besides the one small fast weapon, for the reason I just listed (everything has to hit). It's literally just choosing what you want your attack combo to look like, and maybe some consideration to range.  Now, how about upgrades?

To unlock your special move, you have to locate a unique item for that weapon and upgrade it at the workbench or anvil.  You also *cannot switch weapons* without going back to the hub, which you cannot do regularly because there *is no fast travel.* The other alternative is finding a specific item related to that weapon, which is an item you have to "use."  However, these items tend to be hidden. That's right, they made weapon switching an item usage.  By the way, that goes for shells, too.

You can't just stop and switch your class outside the hub. You have to find a *consumable* item to switch your class out in the wild (no joke, these do NOT refresh on rest).  If you want to swap out before a boss, since there's no fast travel, you have to go *all the way back to the starting hub* or burn an item.  How bout travel, then?

There's no fast travel from point to point.  There is an infinite use item to go back to the start of the zone you're in and lose your important resource, glimpses, which don't drop on death anyway.  It's literally simpler to teleport by letting enemies kill you and respawning. If you have your shell's sidegrades unlocked, which is all glimpses do, you won't even care then.

Finally, enemies.  Half the ones had throws that'll eat huge chunks of HP, can't be parried, and are long-range lunges.  Some bosses have them and they ignore parrying AND blocking.  There's an abundance of snipers that always stun when they hit you, overlooking fight zones with heavy enemies that can two shot you.  There's multiple ambushes in every zone that are completely untelegraphed, and no way to trigger them early when you DO know about them. There's no dogs, but there's worse- poisonous suicide bomber frogs.  It's actually impossible to hit them due to how the combat animations work, their size, and when they explode.  You whiff high on every attack as they approach, and angled attacks are aimed where a torso would be, but they're on the ground.  Furthermore, they're in thin tunnels, so you just have to accept getting poisoned or burn a poison immunity.

Even Salt and Sanctuary did things better.

Giriş

Salt and Sanctuary; Ska Studio'nun yaptığı, oyun dünyasının ilk büyük çaplı souls-like metroidvania yapımı. 2016 çıkış yapan bu yapım cidden bu 2 türü de kendi içinde çok iyi bir şekilde birleştirmiş. Sadece iki türü birleştirmekle kalmayıp aynı zamanda iki türün özelliklerini cidden aşırı üst seviyede yaparak başarısını ortaya koyuyor.

Oyunun Türkçe dil desteğine sahip olması da ayrı şekilde güzel.

Hikâye ve Atmosfer

Krallıklar arasında savaşın neredeyse patlak vereceği kaotik bir dönemde , ortam biraz sakinleşsin ve barış yapılsın diye iki krallık evlilik yapmaya karar veriyor. Biz de diğer krallığa prensesi götüren ekibin bir parçasıyız. Gemiyle yolculuğumuzu yaparken gemi saldırıya uğruyor ve saldırı sırasında gemi batıyor. Bu olaylar sırasında bir şekilde bayılan biz de uyandığımızda kendimizi bir kıyıda buluyoruz. Amacımız prensesi bulmak ve her neredeysek buradan çıkmak. Temel hikaye örgüsü bu. Aslında çok güzel bir dünya yaratılmış. Şu an spoiler olacağından anlatmıyorum ama çok güzel bir lore yaratılmış.

Hikaye anlatımı souls oyunlarının çoğunda olduğu gibi çevresel anlatım şeklinde ilerliyor. Yollarda ilerlerken gördüğüm şeyler , insanların anlattıkları falan bilmediğim olayları gün yüzüne çıkarıyor ve olaylara derinlik katıyor. Tabii ki de bu anlatım hikayenin çok büyük planda olduğu yapımlar kadar iyi olmasa da , aradığımız şeyi tamamiyle verdiğini düşünmekteyim. Oyunun iki sonu var. Ama bu olay gene her Souls oyununda olduğu gibi çok minik olayları yapıp yapmadığımıza göre değişen bir yapıda. Yani yapımı değil de varlığı tatmin edici son tarzlarından.

️Oynanış Mekanikleri️

Oyunun kontrolleri eski bir oyun olmasına rağmen oldukça akıcı ve genel oyun şeması kolay. Ama yeni başlayanlara çok yardımcı bir yapıda olduğunu söyleyemem. Bazı kendisine özgü mekanikleriyle Souls oyunlarından ayrılıyor ve bu durumun işimizi kolaylaştırmıyor. Oyunun genel zorluğu Souls oyunlarından biraz daha az olsa da kolay olduğu kesinlikle söylenemez. Hatta zor demek aşırıya kaçmaz.

Silah çeşitliliği oldukça fazla. Ama genel olarak belirli bir sınıfa kısıtlı kaldığımızdan ve skill tree de kullandığımız puanları yeniden düzenleme mekaniği olmadığından direk başka bir sınıfa geçme durumunuz olmuyor. Mekanikler klasik souls mekanikleri zaten. Stamina kontrolü , dodge , parry , hafif atak , ağır atak falan. Oyunda çoğu Souls oyununda olan mezhep mekaniği var. Bu mezhepler bu oyunda diğer souls oyunlarına göre çok daha önemli yer tutuyor. Çünkü direk sağladıkları kaynaklar senin oyun tarzını etkiliyor. Mesela rahip sınıf büyülerini sadece bir mezhep veriyor kalan hiçbir mezhep sana bu büyüleri sağlamıyor gibi gibi. Aynı zamanda bu mezheplerin getiridiği çok güzel bir mekanik var. Oyunda sandıklardan falan belirli totemler buluyoruz. Bulduğumuz bu totemleri bulduğumuz checkpoint'lere yerleştirerek o checkpoint'in içerisine farklı özelliklere sahip dükkan tarzı yerler açabiliyoruz ve bu totemleri koymamız aynı zamanda totem koyduğumuz bölgelerde bize ek özellikler kazandırıyor. Mesela keşif totemi bize farklı checkpoint'ler arasında fast travel imkanı sunarken aynı zamanda koyduğumuz bölgede mob'lardan düşen itemların düşme oranını arttırıyor.

Genel düşman ve boss yapay zekası oldukça kaliteli. Ama boss'ların kalitesi hakkında bunu söyleyebileceğimi sanmıyorum. Boyutu küçük boss'ların çoğu güzel fight'lar sağlarken boyutu büyük boss'ların çoğu genel mekaniksel kısıtlıklardan dolayı oldukça kolay boss'lara dönmüş. Bazı boss'lar ise zor olmasını sadece 1-2 bozuk harekete borçlu olduğundan bu konuda tam bir tutarlılık sağlanamamış. Zaten oyunda genel olarak boss'ların hasarının az olduğunu düşünüyorum. Ama aynı şekilde bazılarının belirli saldırıları var , bir kere vurduğunda kombo yapıp sana tek atabiliyor. Yani bu konuda minik sıkıntılar olduğunu söyleyebilirim.

️Grafik ve Sanat Tasarımı ️

Başta çok basit bir tasarıma sahip gibi görünse de aslında oldukça hoş bir yapısı var. Genel renk paletinin tercihinden dolayı zaten karanlık hava içimize işliyor. Çevre tasarımı da oldukça hoş. Her bölgenin birbirinden farklı yapısı oldukça belli oluyor. South Park misali karakter tasarımları insanı rahatsız edebilir cinsten ama ona da alışıyorsun. Animasyonların öyle aşırı mükemmel tarafları yok ; yeterli ve güzeller.

Sonuç ve Değerlendirme

Klasik mekaniklerin oyuna çok güzel entegre edilmiş olması
Mezhep mekaniği
Harita tasarımı
Düşman çeşitliliğinin fazla olması

Map'in olmaması
Bazı boss tasarımlarının basit kaçması

Oyun dünyasının ilk büyük çaplı souls-like metroidvaniası olan Salt and Sanctuary; bu türün ilki olmasına rağmen bazen nasıl bu kadar iyi olmasıyla insanı cidden şaşırtıyor. Her iki türün sevdalısını da kendisine çekebilecek bir yapım. Oyun beni o kadar içine çekti ki oynamaya başlamamın 3. gününün sabahı oyuna nokta koydum. Bayıldım.

🅐🅛🅣🅘🅝

Salt and Sanctuary is a weird experience, and it's the best I can describe it. It is all a metroadvania game should not be. It has an interesting gameplay, a bit sloppy controls, OK sound design and overall has tough as nails boss fights and a over-simplistic story. Its souls-like elements feel unfinished. All of the classes - even the Rogue - feel slow to control, this feels like a huge step-down from its competitors such as Hollow Knight. This game has too much gore, it remains a mystery as to what the developer was smoking. The game's sinister atmosphere creates unease.
My verdict is 7/10: it has good character customization and an OK gameplay.

Прошел я salt and sanctuary, игра неожиданно оказалось очень крутой. Игры серии souls изначально по сути своей были переносом жанра метроидвания на рельсы 3D, очень уникальным и своеобразным но все же. Salt and sanctuary еще раз перевернула ситуацию, она перенесла dark souls на рельсы 2D. С самого начала игра дает понять на что она опирается и вообще этого не скрывает, скорее прямо заявляет, что вот мы - фанаты dark souls и сделали игру под копирку, так как ее обожаем. Изначально я скептически отнесся, но когда влился оказалось что это нереально круто, жанр метроидвания идеально сочетается с dark souls, как атмосферой, так и боевкой. Тут присутствует почти все элементы присущие souls - ковенанты, души, множество разного оружия и брони, боссы и т.д. Ты как будто реально играешь в dark souls но в 2D. Боссы очень простые, проходятся с 1-2 раз, последнего босса убил с первого раза, но возможно я собрался как имба, играл фулл хэви билдом с двуручником и щитом. Основная проблема игра - отсутствие карты, насколько вы можете знать - в дарск соулс карты нет, но дарк соулс это не метроидвания, а тут огромный 2д мир И БЕЗ КАРТЫ! Скорее всего большинство людей сошли бы с ума из-за отсутствия карты и дропнули игру еще на середине или даже раньше, но поскольку я топографический гигант, то я выдержал, люди не готовые перманентно держать карту в голове не перенесут такого напряжения. Однако, если вы любите дарк соулс и метроидвании, ТО БЕГИТЕ ИГРАТЬ СРОЧНО ИГРА ИМБА! 8 из 10

Recomendo à todos. Joguei em minhas férias de trabalho por um bom tempo, e tenho que dizer que o jogo só me impressionou de acordo com o tempo. Ele me lembra os antigos jogos de plataforma e também me lembra os jogos com características de SoulsLike, sua ambientação é muito boa e sua história é ótima de acompanhar. Para quem está acostumado com Dark Souls, esse jogo é mais fácil e rápido, porém muito divertido.

Notas:
Se você foca em diversão o jogo é: 10/10
Se você procura dificuldade e tenta se provar:7/10
Dito isso, 9/10
For metroidvania fans. Pros.: story; locations, map, upgrades. Cons.: no minimap and map access; overall difficulty and forcing into grinding.

Good souls-like metroidvania side scroller. Despite being among the first in this genre, it still holds up well. The character creator looks weird and almost makes it feel light-hearted, but once in game, everything is a lot darker and looks much nicer.

RECOMENDADÍSIMO
Me he pasado 95 juegos en mi vida(sí, llevo la cuenta con una lista, soy un friki),  y he jugado a muchísimos más.
Quiero dar ese dato para demostrar que soy un gamer empedernido y darle el valor que este juego se merece al decir que lo situaría en el top 5 de los juegos que más he disfrutado en mi vida. Y escribo esto 6 años después de haberlo jugado, (no es la calentada de según te terminas un juego, lo digo con la mente fría).
La música de los combates contra jefes, que sigo recordando aún a día de hoy, la atmósfera oscura, un diseño artístico fabuloso, los mil escondites y secretos que hay por el mundo, los combates tan difíciles y desafiantes que tiene, las infinitas posibilidades de personalización y enfoque del personaje para el combate...y pensar que esta obra maestra fue creada tan solo por 2 personas...
Lo último que quiero decir es que tiene una "secuela" que se llama "salt and sacrifice" y que pongo secuela entre comillas porque no sigue la trama del primero y porque es una absoluta BASURA, que no le llega ni a los pies a esta primera entrega original y no exagero al decir que lo empeora absolutamente todo. En mi vida he visto una decadencia tan bestia de una segunda parte de un juego(a la altura del bajón de Dragon Age II). Pero lo dicho, SALT AND SANCTUARY ES DIOS.

Oh well, this one was LIT! I received Salt and Sanctuary as a free epic store game at christmas, and I couldnt stop playing it during the whole holidays.

As a Dark Souls and metroidvania fan, I couldnt be more surprised, how this synergy of genre works in this game. The art style is just perfect, gameplay and combat is just as punishing as in souls games. The exploration element, skill gaining and backtracking - things that are defining metroivania works here more then well.

As for the combat itself, maybe it could be more "complex", but the difficulty is ramping up with few bosses. Overall it keeps the metroidvania's combat style and feel.

If you like metroidvanias and/or dark souls, this is a game for you as even if you will get bullied over and over, you won't be able to stop playing until you finish it.

As many other have described this is a mix of DS / Castlevania. Overall I loved it and considering the team behind this i have to give it a 10 / 10. I dont know if theres a lot of replayability because at the end of the day its pretty linear. My mage playtrhough was very fun and challenging altough the end of the game got way easier.
+ graphics, music, atmospehre, builds, mechanics / - replayability, navigation

Сначала игра не понравилась совсем, убивали через каждые пару минут...разобраться было сложно ...какое оружие и броню выбрать...во что вкачивать левел апы...что за религия...что за "соль"...куда идти...карты нет...но потом более менее разобравшись затянуло...Даже пройдя игру так и не разобрался во всём :) После посмотрел прохождения на Youtube, понял чуть больше...про религии, про бафы на оружие...оказалось что не убил 2 босса...просто потому что запутался где я был, а где я ещё не был :) Игра не без минусов, но достойная :)

With 200+ hours in S&S and 600+ across all 3 Dark Souls games, this is about as close to it as you can get without actually playing Dark Souls. Beautiful art, music is meh with a few exceptions, and fun gameplay.

Да какого хрена у противников не прерываются атаки и каст спеллов, а мувсеты у боссов начинаются практически одинаково? И кто-то всерьёз ставит этому шлаку что-то больше ноля не видя, что даже основная механика сломана к чертям!
Souls-like платформер, который по началу интересен, но к середине как то поднаскучил.
bored, no funny, not interesting and very colourless. why am i playing this game? for only boss fight or something?

S&S is pretty much advertised as '2D Dark Souls', but it falls short of it's 3D inspiration on many accounts. The graphics are mediocre mid to upper flash game tier. Forget about feeling something like immersion in this game. The general theme of the background music, if present at all, alternates between repetitive and repetitive & annoying.
Weapon and armor balance is probably S&S's weakest part. Items are tiered from 1 to 5. High tier weapons are awkwardly placed and mostly useless filler - by the time you get to craft tier 3/4 stuff you can already access tier 5, making the former pointless. Lower tier weapons are simply not worth upgrading, unlike in dark souls. Lore consists of RPG boilerplate mediocrity sprinkled with the expected DS references - same for level design. It's not bad, but nothing really stands out as innovative or memorable either.
Combat.... sigh. It quickly becomes cheap and unrewarding - there is only so much you can do in this regard in a 2D engine. Total opposite to the original. There are enemies that pounce you or have some other lockdown (in some  cases instant kill) mechanic if you get close, enemies that have long range melee which you need to evade between attacks ( rinse and repeat) and various projectile attacks. The parrying system is a bit easier than in DS. High HP pools on the mob side combined with limited HP and few opportunities to attack on your side feel like something in between an attempt between a ramped up version of Dark Souls difficulty. Bosses basically require learning of patterns as well as their faster alternates which trigger once the 50% HP mark is reached, making for very drawn out fights. If that's your thing, or if you enjoy spending hours just getting through one boss pretty much every single time, this might be the one thing that will give you some enjoyment in this game. But if you think ornstein and smough or manus type fights felt least rewarding about DS, chances are you wont enjoy the boss fights in S&S because 'fast and aggressive' is the common theme here.
Blending out the copious boss fights there's actually pretty little content in the game. Excusable because there are only two devs from what I've heard but it's another thing that makes the game feel a bit too much like something that evolved from a cheap flash game hobby project. Which makes you wonder why you had to pay to play it.

Una auténtica lástima.

Desearía que me gustara este juego, pero no va a ser posible. Salt and Sanctuary solo se ha dedicado a matarme injustamente y a robarme mis merecidas almas; pero el mayor pecado de SaS es, sin duda, el olvidar que SaS es otro juego, no un remake de Dark Souls en 2D.

Había jugado en el pasado un remake de DS para Spectrum, un pequeño juego hecho en coña parodiando el original. Ese remake para Spectrum, aún siendo una parodia hecha por un fan, aportó elementos en su jugabilidad que no se habían visto en el DS original, no muchos, pero algo nuevo metió.

Esto no lo ha hecho SaS, se ha olvidado de su propia identidad, y se ha limitado a calcarlo todo de DS, solo dejando sin copiar los elementos imposibles en un entorno 2D. Además, ha fallado al entender porqué DS funciona, lo que tampoco le ayudó a copiarlo bien.

Es una auténtica lástima, insisto, llevo siguiendo este juego durante años y lo he jugado ahora solo para llevarme un batacazo y una decepción, con todo lo que prometía.

Tal vez, no sé, los developers ahora hagan un DLC arreglando el juego básico y añadiendo más contenido, copiando lo que ocurrió con DS 2, pero algo me dice que no va a ser así, y que este juego llamado SaS que parece un prototipo, seguirá siendo un prototipo toda la eternidad.

Insisto, una verdadera lástima.

Criminally under-appreciated game. OverBorder studio (which is a team of only 7 people, to the best of my knowledge) made a game who's biggest flaw was that I just wish there was more of it. It's not perfect, sure. But the music, atmosphere, and gameplay make for a truly enjoyable souls-like experience.

Towards the end, I was a little disappointed with enemy variety. I think they probably needed a couple more tough later game enemies. Additionally, I was begging for one or two more unique and challenging bosses by the end. The Odur fight at the beginning is notoriously challenging, but I absolutely LOVED it. It was incredibly satisfying to learn the timings and movements of his combos. Unfortunately, I don't think any of the following bosses are nearly as good as that first one, but they're still all pretty respectable.

TLDR, great game, wish there was a little more content.
I love the lore of the fallen kingdom and should 100% be continued, it distracts me all day and it is one of the best games ive played in a while

Please do not be discouraged by the beginning of the game, as it is only difficult and looks unimpressive at the start. The storyline is also challenging initially, but later it becomes understandable with notes, videos, conversations – it’s well done. As a long-time fan of Spiders games (still waiting for Mars War Logs 2 and Technomancer 3!), I must add my opinion. Pros:

- Great music and atmosphere (the first time I see robots with souls). 
- Fun combat, though it gets a bit tedious after side missions with recycled locations (if you play just the main story, it remains consistently good). 
- Good graphics in most locations, mainly urban and underground; the worst is the beginning of the game and the bastille when walking by the river (but I play on low settings) – the river is awful, and what’s beneath it    
- Very interesting, though serious story, definitely has potential for development (despite the robotic elements, it’s emotional, and the historical thread picks up later)
- Huge selection of weapons, fewer outfits, but it's okay    Nice protagonist, relatable, has a cool voice   
- Nice storyline characters (though I discarded La Fayette)   
- Cool feature with the vestals where you buy things 
-  Also like the new options over time, such as breaking walls or the rope for climbing higher (though there could be more of this) 
-  Quite a variety of enemies, but towards the end, you know them too well and maybe four more would be needed  
-  Worth buying the Discus Chain DLC, as it can attack from a distance and interrupts many enemy attacks

Cons:  
-  Terrible optimization, on an RX6600 I have to play on nearly minimal settings, and still, the fps can drop from 80 to 30 in many places. Luckily, I like this game enough to grit my teeth; the worst are a few options including textures, which even on high can exceed 8GB VRAM usage, not to mention ultra, and they aren’t even hyper beautiful; the game also takes quite a long time to load on HDD 
-   Lack of newer FSR (1.1 looks ugly and helps little) etc.  
-  Lack of patches for the game, as if the developers abandoned it  
-  A downside is part of the combat where the enemy can attack even if we attacked them; that is, our attacks do not interrupt the enemy's attack animation, though sometimes they do (probably a paralysis issue); the best is to play with the chain as you can hit from a distance, avoiding enemy attacks 
-   Poor character development; I played as a dancer, focused only on strength, health, and stamina, the rest seemed unnecessary (unfortunately)    
- The first location is a downside as it puts many people off the game and they return it, as it’s not as carefully made; once you get through it, it’s great  
-  Zero game balance; I’m someone who kills the monsters on hand, destroys all crates, so I collect various items and have a lot of them 

And yes. The beginning of the game is as hard as Dark Souls, but you can level up and develop your character, so you manage (I play without assists). Then the game is moderately difficult and fun. However, at the end, I play with one hand. At the end of the game, I had around level 40, weapons upgraded to level 5, over 100 healing oils, 50 grenades, lots of HP. Just any boss I encounter takes maybe 10-15 attacks, throw a few grenades at him, add a special attack, and the boss is gone. And I have so many healing tools that there’s no fear of losing life. I just play the game without major emotions, unfortunately. I play only because I like the overall setting, atmosphere, but there’s no challenge.

And I play without assists, so I don’t understand people who need assists. Really only the beginning of the game is hard (indeed too hard). But then not anymore. Then you have various special attacks, the weapon has 2 attacks, you have fire, ice, and lightning attacks. There’s really a lot of it. Therefore, the game offers many development options, equipment, various attacks, it’s overwhelming at the beginning. But later, when you know how to use it, the game becomes very easy. Really very easy. With high endurance, you also easily dodge enemy attacks and don’t get tired, which is obviously a plus for people who don’t like Dark Souls, as there you have to be 10x more careful.

I would buy the game for up to 150 PLN if only it had good optimization, FSR/DLSS updates, and if the developers didn’t abandon it.

Of course, I hope for a Steelrising 2, but seeing that the developers don’t like sequels to their games, I probably won’t get my **** I also hope the game brought some financial success. Because it’s really not bad. The beginning of the game is off-putting, the story is not understood, the game is difficult to master, and the first boss is also very hard, the optimization is terrible, but if these were improved, it would really be a solid 8/10.

Steelrising es un soulslike que innova muy poco (alguna de las armas son algo originales, y puedes saltar y tienes algo más de movilidad que en otros juegos del género) pero ejecuta bien lo que se propone hacer. Para mi tiene una virtud innegable en su ambientación, ya que la Francia revolucionaria está desgraciadamente muy poco explorada en juegos o películas y es un periodo fascinante, incluso en esta versión fantástica. Caminar por las calles del París de la época, visitar palacios y lugares importantes como la Bastilla o Versalles, es genial. La historia en sí está bien pero tampoco es para tirar cohetes, pero sin duda está mejor contada que en cualquier Souls, cuenta con diálogos y decisiones que afectan al final de la historia, etc. Y el combate es ágil y fluido, con una personalización del personaje más simple que en un Souls pero que funciona decentemente bien. Gráficamente no pasará a la historia, especialmente algunas animaciones faciales flojean un poco, pero como ya dije la ambientación me fascina y está muy bien recreada, con lo que a nivel visual acaba resultando un juego distinto y bienvenido. Quizás algunas zonas se hacen demasiado parecidas entre sí. A nivel de sonido está todo lo bien que se puede esperar, tanto en efectos, como voces (me gusta que intercalen palabras en francés) como en el apartado musical. Y en cuanto a bugs, he encontrado muy pocos y todos han sido bastante irrelevantes, lo cual siempre es **** resultado es que, sin ser un juego memorable, sin duda es un buen juego en su género. Un 7.

Leggendo le recensioni pensavo fosse veramente fatto male male però devo dire che tutto sommato è piacevole,certo non è un capolavoro il combat system è legnoso,la storia non è un grande e il level design si poteva fare meglio,però l'immaginario e fantastico e la mobilita di Aegis con tutti i suoi gadget è straordinaria, il livello di difficoltà generale per essere un Souls non è il massimo l'ho trovato abbastanza semplice,i titani magnifici, consigliato a chi non trova nulla di meglio

Yet another Dark Souls clone - yawn! Enough already! Souls mechanics aren't that great to be copy & pasted over and over again!
There is nothing new to see here, you once again collect [insert game currency] after slaying enemies, when you die you respawn at the last [insert game save point] you rested at and have one chance to reclaim [game currency] by returning to that spot without dying again. Using [game save point] also respawns all enemies except for bosses. The game's main goal is to fight bosses and mini bosses, yada yada, nothing new here.
Steelrising drops the grimdark atmosphere in favor of an overly colorful 18th century France backdrop with robots(!). I prefer the dark fantasy which is why this one rates even lower than Thymesia for me. Graphics themselves are alright but nothing to write home about. Unfortunately the game is very poorly optimized so be prepared for a lot of stuttering - in a game that relies entirely on timing! Frame dips are frequent this is an absolute no-go. How these 10 out of 10 morons simply ignore this is beyond me.
The reason some reviewers seem to get overly excited about Steelrising's graphics probably is due to the fact that the big front runners FromSoft have delivered their games with the same outdated graphics engine from 2011 on and all other titles look next gen by comparison.
Steelrising also makes the mistake of putting a $50 price tag on this game. Sorry it's a C game lacking anyinnovation, worth $20 max! Definitely a wait for a deep deep sale and only if you are a die hard Souls fan and need to own every game in this "genre". There are much better titles (Mortal Shell, Lords of the Fallen) than this. If you want something that isn't dark fantasy (why would you?) Deck 13 has you covered with The Surge 2.
Hard pass & refund on my side. Sorry.
Graphics are terrible, cant run ultra textures with RTX 3080 and it looks like 2012 title at best, they didnt optimize it at all i guess, this game looks and plays like cheap DS clone.

At its heart, Sea of Thieves revolves around the thrill of exploration and the hunt for treasure. Players set sail across a beautiful, open world filled with islands, shipwrecks, and hidden coves, all packed with treasures to be found. While on these voyages, you can encounter various threats, including rival players who may be looking to steal your loot, or AI-controlled enemies like skeleton crews that provide exciting combat **** shared-world nature of Sea of Thieves adds an unpredictable element to your journeys. You never know when you might cross paths with another crew, which can lead to tense standoffs or full-blown naval battles. The freedom to play either cooperatively or competitively keeps the gameplay dynamic, as your treasure hunts may end in epic victories or heartbreaking **** of the game's most thrilling aspects is the random encounters with legendary sea monsters. You might be peacefully sailing with a hold full of treasure when suddenly the waters turn dark, and the Kraken's tentacles emerge from the deep. Or you may hear the ominous growl of the Megalodon stalking your ship.
One of the standout features of Sea of Thieves is its highly detailed and enjoyable navigation system. Steering your ship is not just a matter of pointing in the right direction and hitting “go.” Instead, it involves a range of ship management tasks: raising and lowering sails, adjusting their angle to catch the wind, managing the anchor, and even patching up holes when your ship takes **** collaborative nature of managing a ship with a crew of friends makes this experience especially fun. Each crew member has a role, from helming the ship to navigating using the map, or managing the cannons during combat. The sense of teamwork needed to successfully sail and survive in the open world is one of the game’s most satisfying elements.While Sea of Thieves nails the navigation and exploration aspects, the combat system leaves much to be desired. Whether fighting other players or AI-controlled enemies, the melee and ranged combat can feel unsatisfying and overly simplistic. The melee combat, in particular, often devolves into repetitive and "spamy" exchanges where players simply mash attack buttons rather than using any sort of strategy or **** some players, the experience of sailing the high seas in Sea of Thieves can come with an unfortunate side effect: motion sickness. The game’s realistic ship movement, combined with the rolling waves and constant swaying, can cause dizziness or nausea for those prone to motion sickness. Spending extended periods navigating the ocean can exacerbate this, especially during storms or rough seas, when the ship’s motion becomes even more pronounced.

Игра отлично подходит если у вас обнаружены какие либо психические отклонения, в особенности психопатия, социофобия или анорексия. Главный парадокс этой игры найти смысл: Как не взять в рот в этой игре?

Ответ: никак
Пустота: Ум опустел, оставив лишь эхо тщетных усилий. Мысли растворились, как сахар в воде, не оставив ни вкуса, ни следа.Исчерпанность: Все пути исхожены, все методы испробованы. Борьба с оковами разума обернулась бесконечным кругом, ведущим никуда.Принятие: Осознание собственного бессилия. Принятие того, что освобождение – это иллюзия, а разум – это тюрьма, из которой нет выхода.Спокойствие: В опустошенном разуме воцарилась тишина. Утихли бури сомнений и терзаний, оставив лишь безмятежность пустоты.Парадокс: Осознание "никак" одновременно является и поражением, и освобождением. Это отказ от борьбы, но и принятие реальности.

Rust was released to an “early access” stage in late 2013, debuting to a peak of 22,000 players in the release month. As of now, Rust has peaked at approximately 260,000 concurrent players in January of 2025, more than ten times increase. Rusts growth has been continuous, due to the “Force Wipe,” a concept that on the first Thursday of every month they release a big update, wiping everyone's progress, across all servers. Rust is from the development studio, “Facepunch,” responsible for games such as “Garry’s Mod,” a sandbox game where anything is possible, and “Chippy,” an arcade style game based on the mechanics of “Space Invaders.” Rust is a multiplayer survival game, comparable to the likes of “Ark Survival Evolved” and “Day Z,” both of which are also set in post-apocalyptic warfare filled maps. These types of games are immensely popular due to their sadistic nature, taking others hard-earned resources for your own gain. Rust has been one of the most consistent games i have ever played, every single month they release a noticeable update to change the meta of the game. This keeps the gameplay fresh, this in addition to the server “Wipes” makes sure that players will be able to play for the whole month without it starting to feel old. However, this makes Rust extremely addicting, and very impactful on social life.  Rust is based on a post-apocalyptic island, leaving the island radioactive. It is rumoured that the island which all players first interact with was infested with the likes of a cold war, the island was used as a testing ground for weapons and personnel to do as they will. This left it in a state of warfare and an idea of “every man for himself.” Rust is a difficult game to learn, and it takes a long time to learn the mechanics, let alone to gather enough knowledge to be able to take fights, at the right time, with the right weapons and with the right amount of people. In Rust you also must learn recoil patterns along with refining your aim to insure you will hit your shots, without learning you are bound to lose every fight you take. In Rust there is not a definitive end, you can always have more resources, raid more people, take more fights. That's the beauty of Rust, you can never actually “complete” the game, this is what keeps players consistent through the month, chasing a never-ending goal. Since you never actually can complete Rust there is no “replay”, however, there is a concept of server “Wipes”, where there is a set schedule and on the day specified everyone's progress gets reset, just for them to go back and get it all again, showing the true nature of Rust. Rust’s settings are vast and varied, however you cannot modify the game farther than they let you, since its multiplier they must discourage and punish third party programs, especially ones that aim to modify the games memory. Rust is available on Steam, PlayStation Store, and Microsoft Store on XBOX, bearing in mind Rust is not cross-platform since PC players would have an advantage. Rust usually sells for £34.99; this is on console stores and on steam. Rust hovers around a 40GB size, reasonable for the large amount of content. Rust pays a large amount of attention to the graphics, the greenery and the buildings all have intricate details to make them look as realistic as possible, and they do an excellent job at it, the interiors of the “monuments” are all rustic, adding to the feel of a post-apocalyptic island. Rust has a variety of sound effects and music cues, the gun sounds are somewhat realistic, although not the best, the music is commissioned especially for rust and gives an aurora of creepy, scary survival. Rust changes the sounds depending on the environment a player is in, for example in a cave, sounds reverb and appear louder and somewhat inaccurate, while above ground there is a distinct sound for everything and a direction of where it came from is recognizable. This is unique and enhances the player experience, really helps in a survival game. Rust usually does not experience many bugs, every update is meticulously tested before being pushed to the main branch, additionally they have a “staging” branch which allows players to play updates before they are officially released, allowing for user-reported bugs to be fixed and community feedback to be taken before a new update. Rust is a multiplayer game, the game requires an online aspect to actually be enjoyable, other players are out to get your resources and you have to protect them, no matter if you’re online or offline, which introduces a sense of urgency to get back to the game and play it for even longer. In conclusion, Rust is absolutely a game to try if you have not played it already, it has a certain player base who chase the adrenaline of losing and gaining resources throughout a period, making it intense and exciting. Although, I'd be careful about the addictiveness of it, it's no joke how many hours you can pour into this game without realising.

Rust Huh, the game that made my childhood better since I was watching the continuity creators on YouTube back when Zombies were on the map. I ended up playing with a friend for about 140 hours, most of which hours were done on empty servers or done by one of my friends using our monthly subscription initiated servers. Initially, I would have several reasons not to recommend the game, mainly because one of those main reasons is the overpriced price. But instead, I won't do this, because from my point of view, for how many hours I invested in the game and how I didn't feel them passing by me, being the game at the same time and very fun, I suppose they deserved their money. Starting with the worst phases of the game, as long as you don't play on a server made by you, you can't really put your soul into what you created or built on the game. In the game there is the wipe term, which at the choice of the owner who owns the server, can be: weekly, every two weeks, or every month) After this deadline, the whole map returns to its initial form from the beginning without any progress. The houses, your items in the inventory and everything you have mined or collected will disappear and you will basically get it from the beginning every time. It sounds very bad since most players of Survival games grew up with Minecraft, The Forest or Don't Starve, where in these games your progress was saved for the entire period of ownership. But it's not really like that, this only applies to servers officially listed on the server page of the game, if you want to create a server you can keep it for life without giving it a mandatory wipe but it will be unlisted and not you can set it as public, if you want it public you will have to comply with this requirement. It sounds decent so far, but there is another part to come. For you to be able to maintain a server is not as easy as in other games and especially since the game does not maintain the server created by you. Either you use Wireless Lan Party programs to invite others if you have a map and want it to run on your computer, or you have to buy a server domain which is not at all cheap unlike what I was used to do until now. These would be some disadvantages in what prevents its purchase if necessary. (You can have a public server with "No Wipe" only if there are no servers with Survival game mode. (example: PVP)In the rest, apart from these aspects, the game is ingenious, and comes to its base with a lot of new features and monthly or bi-monthly **** updates do not in any way damage the game or its image and even revive it every time something new appears because you always have something to do in it, especially if you are just starting out with the game and especially if you have a server with Wipe. The idea is that having a server with "No Wipe" you cannot expand your creativity as you want on it, most of the time you end up making a construction with the walls upgraded to the maximum and then you think that you have nothing left to do being that everything you did you did during the construction of the house. That's why Wipe exists, to evolve each player individually and all starting from the same point at the time of the Wipe. Imagine Hungar Games with Unlimited Respwn (that is if you don't play on Hardcore Mode) and with several players all evolving differently and attacking each other to capture territories and get materials from the battle or loots found on Map. The idea is very good and I wonder how since its launch it has not received an award or a congratulation for this complex idea, the basis of which is the community that continues to create and maintain active servers even today after a long time. I haven't really seen any bugs or glitches, the game is decent on the optimization side and the difficulty of the AI ​​in the game is to be congratulated. I recommend the game strictly if you have many friends with whom you can have a Party or Squad for Raids because otherwise it would sometimes seem boring to you and you would want to take a break with the game more and more often until you end up losing your interest completely, so that later to return to it again being a good game. On the music side, they tried to copy different ideas from other well-known Survivor games that have good music, and somehow they came out, but not how the developers expected it to come out. All in all, it's good, but it hasn't received updates with the music packet for a long time and I'd be impatient to see that. There are many things I could talk about when it comes to this game, but many of them end up having a positive impact on the game, which makes the final conclusion I recommend it with confidence, especially if you get it at a discount like - I also bought it by the way. I recommend to try for yourself to understand much more than from this review,

Rust is a compelling and intense multiplayer survival game developed by Facepunch Studios, where players must gather resources, build shelters, and engage in PvP combat to survive on a deserted island. Starting with nothing, players quickly scavenge for materials to craft tools and weapons, navigating a challenging day-night cycle and constant threats from other players. The game's building and crafting systems are deep and rewarding, allowing for the creation of complex bases and equipment. Voice chat enhances social interactions, fostering alliances and rivalries within large servers. Despite its brutal and unforgiving nature, Rust offers an enriching experience as players outlast competitors and thrive in a hostile environment, making it a must-play for fans of survival games!
[SPOILER ALERT: This review contains spoilers.]

Created by Facepunch, a group known for games such as g-mod, comes Rust. This PvP survival game pits you against both the struggles of surviving on a stranded island with no escape, but also the threat of other people and NPCs. Rust differs from other games in this genre because of its vast plethora of mechanics alongside a seemingly simple premise: survival.  Rust has a reputation for being a very challenging, unforgiving game, but I believe this simply adds to the excitement. Although it might seem that after a short while, there may be nothing new to do, but the constant fear of losing all your progress to either another player or natural causes is what makes this game stand out, as there is no safety for your hard-earned resources when offline.  This does, however, cause many players to develop severe addictions, with many members of the community gaining hour counts into the thousands.  Rust is well known for its steep learning curve, with players being judged harshly by others based on their playtime alone. The gunplay in this game also is quite difficult, making players memorize recoil patterns for many different guns, and get used to the fast time to kill. Even with the short TTK, fights involving larger groups can last hours at a time, with neither side wanting to leave the battle after putting so much time and resources in.   Many servers also introduce prizes and incentives such as bounties for the most competitive clans to compete for. This leads to the formation of very large groups, sometimes with 40+ players, working together to win money on a regular basis. The nature of the game, however, means that to keep a bounty for long enough to be cashed out, the clans have to stay active on a single server for days at a time, often leading to many sleepless nights lying in wait for an attack.  The gameplay loop can vastly vary in length with some so called ‘wipes’ lasting anywhere from a couple days to over a month. However, even though it may seem repetitive, with little variation on the gameplay, each wipe has many different encounters with new people each time, leading to an enjoyable experience for as long as you make it enjoyable.  Rust is available on both console and PC, costing upwards of £20, and can be played on either keyboard and mouse or most standard modern controllers. However, the advantages offered by keyboard and mouse leads to problems in the console community with external devices such as zens.  Graphics/Attention to Detail and Environmental interaction/Scenery/Art Direction and Style Rust has a reasonably minimalistic art style, but this doesn’t detract from the game's positives.  The sound design for the game is both immersive and reliable, with most sounds being easily distinguished between. Rust can be very difficult to run on lower end devices, and can often crash alongside excruciating loading times, but there are very few noticeable bugs, and with the game being updated regularly none stay around for too long. One of the worst and best aspects of this game are the interactions with other players. While some can be kind or funny, most are extremely hostile, and the majority of encounters involve a stream of slurs through the microphone. For this reason, I would definitely not recommend this game to younger individuals as a lot of the language and threats used are quite nerve racking for less confident people.  Overall, the game itself has many strong features, but the community does slightly let it down at times.

Marvel Rivals is hands down the best live Service game I’ve played in a long time – and honestly, it’s my number one "on going" game! From the very first match, I was completely hooked. The mix of fast-paced action, strategic teamplay, and that unique Marvel flair is simply unbeatable.Each hero feels distinct and powerful, with their own unique playstyle. The combat system is smooth, dynamic, and super satisfying. The maps are well-designed, and the graphic design shows a real attention to detail.What really stood out to me is the cast – the selection of playable Marvel characters is both diverse and perfectly executed, both visually and in terms of gameplay. Every Marvel fan will find something to love here.I could barely stop playing and I’m already excited for what’s coming next. For me, Marvel Rivals is more than just a great game – it’s become my personal go-to game.

This is currently one of my favorite games to play right now. The gameplay loop is engaging, the art style is incredibly stunning, and the update cycle keeps this game feeling fresh for months on end. The progression for proficiency  feels rewarding with some cool rewards. Each character felt very unique with their own set of lines for every other character and ultimate attacks that feel very distinct and fun to use. The developers are extremely committed to giving the game content at a high frequency, but without rushing the skins, updates, and more out the door unfinished. Despite all that, I cannot ignore the gaping issues within the game. The matchmaking is atrocious, some of the skins are pretty questionable, and the toxic environment can be very unwelcoming. The rank system can sometimes feel like walking through mud. If these things can be fixed, the game has potential to be one of the best multiplayer games on the market, but for now, it stand as an eight out of ten.

Dota 2 is not just a game; it's an experience—a challenging, sometimes infuriating, but ultimately rewarding journey. For those unfamiliar, Dota 2 is a highly complex multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) game that demands strategy, skill, and ****’s be honest: Dota 2 is hard. The steep learning curve can make it feel overwhelming, especially for newcomers. The intricacies of the game mechanics, the vast pool of heroes, and the ever-changing meta can leave even seasoned players scratching their heads. It's not uncommon to feel frustrated, to the point where you might consider breaking your keyboard or mouse after a tough **** that's also what makes Dota 2 the perfect game. The intense emotions it evokes—from the highs of pulling off an incredible play to the lows of a devastating defeat—create memories that last a lifetime. Every game is different, every match a new story.Beyond the gameplay itself, Dota 2 has a way of bringing people together. Whether you're teaming up with old friends or meeting new ones from around the world, the bonds formed through shared victories (and defeats) are strong. Many players find themselves making lasting friendships through the **** conclusion, Dota 2 is a demanding but deeply fulfilling game. It challenges you, pushes you to your limits, but also rewards you with some of the most unforgettable gaming moments. If you're willing to invest the time and effort, you'll find that Dota 2 is not just a game—it's a community, a passion, and a source of endless joy (and maybe a bit of rage too).

Throughout history, there have been numerous moments where discoveries embody the "perfect formula" principle, whether it's fire, the wheel, electricity, Coca-Cola... All of these discoveries or inventions are inherently part of a continuum of refinement driven by civilization's evolving needs through time and space. For example, Chess was played thousands of years ago with unlimited time per move, each piece had very different movement rules and overall rules differed significantly from modern ****, the "perfect formula" of Chess itself remains unchanged and will likely endure as long as our cognitive 'modus operandi' remains as it is. To put it more illustratively, these "perfect formula" discoveries and objects resonate with us much like corners resonate with spiders or trees and rivers resonate with beavers. Our minds are wired to engage with these perfect circuits in all their brilliance, because the human mind is a brilliant invention of evolutionary processes and this engagement is simply enjoyable wallowing in our own **** such perfect circuit, among many others in different fields, is Dota 2. This game is flawless in its **** course, you would make a logical mistake in qualitatively comparing Chess with the wheel, or fire with Coca-Cola, or electricity with Dota 2, or even Chess with Dota 2 - which is usually the case. Each of these phenomena holds its own utility field, and their disparate, incommensurable states should be considered within their own contexts and frameworks. Chess and Dota 2 may have superficial similarities, but they are fundamentally different, like "original Cola" VS "DIY Fanta" different, the only similarity might be the carbonated bubbles in both drinks, which metaphorically could resemble your mental engagement through all aspects of being tricky, witty, or cunning in strategizing and anticipating moves of your opponent in Chess, or timing your spells in Dota 2 either alone or in synergy with your... ****, yes, THE TEAM. Damn. This sounds like it's always the same team and holy f, it actually is. The game has SO MANY players and has been out there for so long that it has crystallized a distinct pattern of mentality, which could literally be captured by the term "Team of Dota 2" with its own hypostatized face. The community in this game deserves special attention; it is a phenomenon that needs a separate review. Actually, it deserves a psycho-pathological study. It's no joke. It's unlike anything I've encountered in any online game before and I'm not using now personal experience (or lack thereof) as a validating instrument for this opinion - it's an objective fact, especially in recent times where its collective mind has reached its peak form.Anyway, back to the game, some surrounding aspects: I've seen many people discredit it, saying things like, "Damn, that game seems complex and time-consuming; I don't have the energy to invest in it." Yet they proceed to play Sudoku or Chess 24/7, others invest time in watching bare-bottom TV shows, some work and provide for their families, others gamble, others read books, etc... Everyone is occupied with something, but the 'rational' fear of this game persists, as if it's a virus that will devour their life like nothing else already does. This perception is completely distorted and based on faulty assumptions. As I said, the game is perfect in its core, and that "perfect formula" allows you to enjoy it endlessly...HOWEVER, THIS DOES NOT MEAN you should sacrifice your personality, abandon your character and dreams just to immerse yourself in this sinkhole. I mean, if you're confused about your priorities and lack essential personal values, that's your own weakness and fault. It's not the game's fault if you're inclined to start compensating for that weakness with a dominance-at-all-costs attitude in the game - initially just trying to win every match, and later becoming hyper-toxic towards others. Would you blame a beer company for your careless driving while drunk, or a casino for losing enormous amounts of money?

If you are already individually dissociated and dissolved into the crystallized Dota 2 mentality, of course you would. Noob.

Ah, Dota 2, that shining beacon of strategic perfection in the online gaming world, where each match is like a musical symphony of plans and tactics. Indeed, it is a game that immensely delights me, melting in the mouth like the culinary creation of a Michelin-starred chef. And the AI incorporated into it? Well, I must admit, its sophistication always astounds me when it pairs me and my "certainly" English-speaking teammates **** is quite astonishing that in this era of technological marvel, which Dota 2 undeniably represents, artificial intelligence has still not found a way to interpret the "Western Europe" and "English" filters so that the outcome matches these settings. As I nobly select these options, I expect to immerse myself in an English-speaking utopia, where each match becomes an oasis of British etiquette and Shakespearean exchange of courtesies. Instead, I often find myself as an unintended guest at a Cyrillic party, where communication is composed of mysterious runes and enigmatic pictograms.I cannot help but wonder if my client is inadvertently a window for the expansion of Russian influence, where every keyboard, regardless of chosen language preferences, is secretly programmed to convert everything into the letters of the Cyrillic alphabet. And I think to myself, oh, how charming, how insightful of Valve to provide me with cultural enrichment without my explicit consent. Indeed, how far can free education go?What an amazing school of patience and interpersonal skills, when this game guides me to mumble phrases in Russian that I've learned amidst the waves of "cyka blyat". Dota 2 is not just a game, but also a language course and a social experiment that broadens my horizons far beyond the usual limits. In its boundless kindness and education, Valve continuously contributes to my personal development. And for that, my endless gratitude.

Warframe is existing for over 12 years now. It has grown incredibly good. The game and its dev team had quite the journey in all this time and they did A LOT for their community. They are a PRIME example of how a dev team should approach the development of their game/product. Personally, I've never seen any game developer that poured so much heart and soul into his product, worked so well with everybody else and their community and did overall so incredibly much to stay alive.
Warframe offers: one of the friendliest communities in all of gaming, a deep, emotional lore, a huge variety of approaches for the gameplay itself, tons of missions, endless customizations, earnable in-game currency (you don't have to invest a single dime!), a huge variety of systems and content within the game.) and much more. And all that: FOR FREE!
It is an experience! 

Warframe is a big mile stone and a well kept secret.
Believe in the game and you won't be dissappointed.
Stay safe, Tenno.

After a certain point of progression in the game it almost seems like the content is endless. It certainly is a hidden gem for players who are just familiar with it. It does have some loose ends though, but pushing a through some time and learning it becomes a real reward.
Warframe lacks in beginner introduction to its game mechanics specifically being the upgrade system and where and how to acquire gear/items. It also lacks in early game story to flesh out the universe and onboard players into the world.
The microtransactions are completely avoidable as players can trade premium currency for in game items.

We could be looking at one of the best F2P in the history of video games. Warframe is a game that mixes fast-paced action action with the precision of a third-person shooter and a great parkour system.
Warframe offers a vast arsenal to suit all playstyles, with over 60 characters with their own unique identities and abilities and a versatile and intuitive build system.
This game will offer you months of fun and content, whether you're playing alone or with friends. And if you ever run out of content, don't worry, Warframe receives new content every few months, expanding its world and possibilities.

The current Warframe is unrecognizable from its version of 11 years ago, many reviews from the time don't do justice to the current state of the game, so don't be intimidated by the old reviews of professional critics.

The early platinum grind is not worth it; it makes the game hundreds of hours longer, and mainly, it is not fun.  If you think you can just go FREE and grind for everything, you WILL SUFFER . The new player experience is realy bad. If you are interested in this game, play it for a while, and then when you get your first 75% platinum discount, make a choice. Either buy 4k platinum with a 75% discount to remove the nonsensical and annoying time-wasting grind for absolute necessities like weapon and warframe slots OR decide that you don't want to make this one-time purchase and leave the game. If you are willing to BUY the starting platinum, it will carry you through the whole game, ONLY THEN you can truly enjoy the experience of progress in this game. Just go read all the other negative reviews; they are all about "hitting the wall" and "repetitive grind," which is all caused by the platinum grind that halts your progress; without it, the game is good; with it, you have to pay for the game to be good. EA has made many highly popular games including all FIFA games and PVZ games, including these games comes along Apex a popular battle royale game. Apex has many competitors which are generally any battle royale, however the main competitors it tends to be fighting is games like Fortnite, and call of duty. Apex has its difficulties, whilst having multiple game modes for players to play and enjoy, the game can get quite repetitive, and players can get bored or frustrated with the game over a period of time. Although the game is a multiplayer game so if you find some good friends to play with you can have endless fun. Apex is set on several mythical islands with one that is a giant ship flying high in the sky, and each island have lots of different POIs and lots of decorations such as huge creatures that look like dinosaurs and some players can even interact with and fight against to collect valuables in the game that will help the player later on in that game. The main aim of the game is to kill every other squad, trio, duo, or person and be the last remaining survivor and be pronounced the Apex champion, although to become a champion, the game has a skill-based matchmaking system, so based on your skill level of the game you will always get put against someone your skill level although sometimes it does have its faults, however there is always something new to learn such as new movement which can confuse your enemies however takes hours of practice to perfect. Apex is a battle royale based game so if you lose one match you can instantly go into a new one giving it constant replay ability and you can play until your hearts content. It is a somewhat modable game where you can access controls within the game files which allow you to set multiple movements to 1 key and set a timer for it which specifically helps in Apex as it helps players who are struggling with all the movement techniques do the with ease.                                                                                             Apex is a cross-platform game allowing players to play with friends on all sorts of game consoles, however apex is a mildly big game as it is 56g to install the base game which may cause problems for some players.                                                                                                Apex legends is a free to play game however some long-time players would argue that buying certain skins in the game would highly benefit the player, but the game is free however what comes with this is that apex can be a very aesthetically pleasing game if played on a powerful enough device and high enough graphics, otherwise the game may look extremely basic, and you may suffer performance issues.                                                                                                                          Apex has a large variety of soundtracks that each player can collect different soundtracks that add a sense of either intense music or fun exciting music, apex also has quite a stable game most of the time with few glitches but sometimes a player can get severely unlucky and run into many glitches or bugs with the game. And sometimes the server. In conclusion Apex is a fun multiplayer game with lots of different game modes for players to enjoy with a constantly changing game modes that will keep players engaged with the game.

Apex Legends is one of EA’s most notable titles, a battle royale game that continues to captivate players around the world even after several seasons. Since its launch, the game has managed to maintain an impressive relevance, not looking its age, thanks to regular updates and the introduction of new content. One of the main reasons for Apex Legends’ continued success is its competitive and accessible development. The game is structured in a way that is friendly to new players, with a gentle learning curve that allows newcomers to quickly adapt to the game’s mechanics. At the same time, the game offers enough strategic depth to keep veteran players challenged and engaged, with a constantly evolving meta and a variety of characters, each with unique abilities. EA has managed to find an effective formula to keep players engaged season after season. The introduction of new characters, game modes, seasonal events, and map updates keep the gameplay experience fresh and exciting. This constant stream of new features and improvements keeps players coming back regularly, avoiding the stagnation that can plague other games in the genre. Despite its success, it’s inevitable that some players have dropped out of the game over time. However, Apex Legends’ player base remains robust, with only a small portion of the original audience having left the game permanently. This is a testament to EA’s ability to keep the game engaging and relevant, ensuring that the majority of players continue to find reasons to stick around and explore the dynamic world of Apex Legends.
